title: arch_linux
body:
An independently developed, x86-64 general-purpose [[Linux]] distribution known for its flexibility, simplicity, and adherence to the "do-it-yourself" (DIY) and KISS ("Keep It Simple, Stupid") principles. It targets competent GNU/Linux users who desire a high degree of control over their operating system.

Arch Linux employs a rolling-release model, providing continuous updates to all packages, including the kernel and system libraries. This contrasts with traditional fixed-release distributions that require periodic major upgrades. Arch provides a minimal base system upon installation, allowing users to build upon it by selecting and installing only the components they require. This user-centric approach grants significant customization and control, but also necessitates a deeper understanding of Linux systems.

h4. External Links
* "Official website":[https://archlinux.org/]
* "Wikipedia: Arch Linux":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arch_Linux]

h4. See Also
* [[Linux]]

title: warrior_feather_(sonic)
body: An accessory upgrade for [[Amy Rose]], first introduced in [i][[Sonic Adventure]][/i]. It attaches to Amy’s [[hairband]] and enables her to perform the Spin Hammer Attack with her Piko Piko Hammer.

title: peppepe
body: A [[rubber duck]]-based Badnik—a type of [[robot]]ic enemy—in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]]. Created by [[Dr. Eggman]], Peppepe first appeared in the game [i][[Sonic Labyrinth]][/i]. In this title, it rolls around and releases sticky, glue-like puddles that can immobilize [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]] until he uses a Spin Dash to defeat it.

title: buzz_bomber
body:
A recurring [[robot]]ic enemy in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]], designed to resemble a [[wasp]]. Created by [[Dr. Eggman]], they fly overhead and fire projectiles at [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]] and friends. They’ve appeared in many titles—from the first [[Sonic the Hedgehog 1|16‑bit Sonic the Hedgehog game]] to later releases like [i][[Sonic Generations]][/i] and [i][[Sonic Lost World]][/i].

Known as "Beeton" in Japan.

title: sonic_labyrinth
body: A 1995 isometric puzzle/action game in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]]. The game puts a unique spin on the traditional Sonic formula. In Sonic Labyrinth, [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]] is forced to wear "Slow Down Boots" that strip away his signature speed and jumping ability, leaving his spin dash as the sole method of movement.

In this form, Metal Sonic is powered up by a massive Dark Ring, which causes him to become much larger and adopt a red, more menacing appearance compared to his standard blue form.

title: crossbone_gundam_x-1
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Crossbone Gundam]].

[b]XM-X1 (F97) Crossbone Gundam X-1[/b]

A custom, pirate stylised mobile suit developed for the [[Crossbone Vanguard]] to be used in the Jupiter Sphere. 

To account for the extreme gravitational pull of Jupiter, it was given a revolutionary X-shaped thruster arrangement that kept the power high and the weight low, granting it fantastic mobility in [[jupiter_(planet)|Jupiter]]'s orbit - and had the additional effect of causing the unit to be borderline out of control in the weaker gravity of [[earth_(planet)|Earth]]. 

It was primarily piloted by [[Kincade Nau]].
other_names: クロスボーンガンダムX1

title: remote_robot_(tails_adventure)
body: Remote Robot, also known in Japanese as "Mecha Tails," is a small, remote-controlled [[drone]] from the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]] built in the likeness of [[Tails (Sonic)|Tails]]. It first appears in the game [i][[Tails Adventure]][/i], where Tails uses it for reconnaissance and item collection. Because of its compact size and flying ability, the Remote Robot can navigate narrow passages that Tails himself can’t access. It even has the ability to transform into a one-man submarine called the Sea Fox for aquatic missions. Although it doesn’t have any offensive capabilities, it plays a crucial role in puzzle solving and exploration by keeping Tails safe while in use.

title: tails_adventure
body: A 2D side‐scrolling platform game in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]], released in 1995 for the Sega Game Gear. In this game, [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]]’s sidekick [[Tails (Sonic)|Tails]] embarks on his first solo adventure on Cocoa Island, where he must navigate 12 non-linear levels, collect various gadgets and bombs, and gather Chaos Emeralds to enhance his abilities while fighting off the invading Battle Kukku Empire.
other_names: テイルスアドベンチャー

title: tabara_seiki
body:
Retired [[real life]] Japanese horse [[jockey]]. Famous for achieving multiple victories with [[Mayano Top Gun (racehorse)|]],  as well as Happy Progress and [[Flower Park (racehorse)|]]. He has also ridden  [[Tokai Teio (racehorse)|]] to victory once in the [[Arima Kinen]].

After retirement he became a racehorse trainer, though sadly his license was revoked after getting into trouble for accidentally bringing a fruit knife in his check-in luggage at an airport (which also landed him in further trouble when searching revealed he had some recreational drugs).

Tabara is also a professional manga author starting back from his jockeying days. His latest work, [i]Hou no Niwa[/i] (The Courtyard of Law) has also been adapted into a television drama. Additionally, Mr. Tabara is a semi-prolific magazine columnist and musician.

h4. External links

* "Youtube: Tokyo Sports Race Channel":[https://www.youtube.com/@tokyosportsmovie]

title: sol_emerald
body:
A set of seven gemstones in the [[sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series. They exist in the Sol Dimension, a parallel dimension to [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]]'s, and are a counterpart of the [[chaos_emerald|Chaos Emeralds]].
The Sol Emeralds are guarded by [[Blaze the Cat]], who can transform into [[Burning Blaze]] when using all seven of them.

title: jeweled_scepter_(sonic)
body: A mystical, ancient relic that first appears in [i][[Sonic Rush Adventure]][/i]. It’s an ornate [[scepter]]—resembling a shepherd’s hook and adorned with various colored [[jewel]]s—that originates from the Sol Dimension, serving as the national treasure of the Sol Empire. For generations, [[Blaze the Cat]]’s royal family has guarded it, as it holds the key to unleashing the "Power of the Stars," a cosmic energy that not only governs geological activity (such as triggering earthquakes and volcanic eruptions) but also sustains and connects parallel universes.

title: gardon_(sonic)
body: An anthropomorphic koala who serves as [[Blaze the Cat]]’s personal guard in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]]. He first appears in [i][[Sonic Rush Adventure]][/i] as a dedicated member of the Coconut Crew from the Sol Dimension. Gardon is known for his loyalty and skilled swordsmanship, often helping Blaze on her quests—such as recovering the [[Jeweled Scepter (Sonic)|Jeweled Scepter]] and locating the [[Sol Emerald]]s—while showing deep respect by addressing her formally. His character has also been featured in various Sonic comics published by Archie Comics and IDW Publishing.

* Skirt: A bright orange, pleated skirt that flares outward.
* Shoes: Light blue sneakers with a white stripe down the middle and white soles. The shoes have orange laces tied in bows.
* Gloves: White gloves.

title: kurokawa_akane
body:
Major supporting character in [[Oshi no Ko]].

She has [[green eyes]] and a [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[blue hair|blue]] [[bob cut]] with [[swept bangs]]. She is usually depicted wearing a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[black sweater vest]], a [[necktie]] or later a [[bowtie]], and a [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]]. She is also seen wearing a [[blue dress|blue]] [[pinafore dress]] and [[high heels|heeled]] [[black footwear]].

She is voiced by [[Iwami Manaka]] (JP) and [[Kristen McGuire]] (EN).

title: tsukumo_sana

She has [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], [[large breasts]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[light brown hair]] (also occasionally depicted with [[blonde hair|light blonde hair]]) which she keeps in [[twintails]] with [[planet hair ornament|planet-themed]] [[hair ornament]]s and [[sidelocks]]. The said ornaments were occupied by a then-unnamed rabbit-like and crab-like creatures on her right hand and left hand side respectively. They were later named [[Usaslug (Tsukumo Sana)|]] and [[Kaniko (Tsukumo Sana)|]].

title: predation
body:
Hunting and killing prey, particularly when done by animals but also sufficiently "feral" humanoid chracters in an animalistic state. For humans hunting with weapons, see [[hunting]]. Primarily done for food but also includes things like cats leaving dead birds. Does not include things like territorial disputes. There must be a clear "hunter and prey" scenerario. 

Includes both in progress hunting and when eating the dead prey. 

h4. Examples

* !post #6167198
* !post #2878958

* [[Feral instincts]]

title: marina_(splatoon)
body:
[[Splatoon 2]] character. Named [b]Iida[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[octoling]].

She is part of the band Off The Hook (Tentacles in the Japanese version) with [[Pearl (splatoon)|]], which has its own television show.

Her default costume & appearance features a black [[crop top|cropped]] [[cropped vest|vest]], [[green pantyhose|green]] / [[aqua pantyhose]] under [[black shorts]], black [[boots]] and black [[fingerless gloves]]. She has a [[navel piercing]] and a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]]. She has [[green eyes|green]] / [[aqua eyes]], often depicted with [[red pupils]] as [[cephalopod eyes]]. She often wears [[headphones]]. She is often depicted with a [[furrowed brow]] / [[raised eyebrows]].

Her Japanese name comes from the word for the "webfoot octopus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amphioctopus_fangsiao (イイダコ [i]Iidako[/i]). As revealed in [i]Octo Expansion[/i], her full name is [b]Marina Ida[/b] in English; [b]Marine Iida[/b] in Japanese.

h4. External Links
* "Inkipedia: Marina":[https://splatoonwiki.org/wiki/Marina]

title: pearl_(splatoon)
body:
[[Splatoon 2]] character. Named [b]Hime[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[Inkling]].

She is part of the band Off The Hook (Tentacles in the Japanese version) with [[Marina (splatoon)|]], which has its own television show.

Her Japanese name comes from the word for the "Northern pygmy squid":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idiosepius_paradoxus (ヒメイカ [i]Hime-ika[/i]). As revealed in Octotune's album booklet, her full name in Japanese is [b]Hime Houzuki[/b].

In her default costume & appearance she wears a [[white dress]], [[pink pantyhose]], black [[fingerless gloves]], white [[shoes]] and a [[crown]]. She has [[thick eyebrows]] and a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]]. She has white / yellow [[star-shaped pupils]]. While she typically has [[two-tone hair|two-tone]], [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[white hair|white]] + [[pink hair]], the white part is sometimes drawn more [[blonde hair|blonde]].

title: bkub_(vtuber)
body:
A Japanese-speaking [[Indie Virtual YouTuber|Indie]] [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] avatar of artist [[bkub]], used when streaming on YouTube. Originally an [[adoptable]] avatar known as Shota Saburou or Shota Mimi-kun, designed by [[Okogemaru Nekosuke]], with Live2D by [[Shigehiro]], before being "purchased":[https://nizima.com/Item/DetailItem/38838] by bkub.

He's a 'shitty middle-aged miyakko [[animal ears|kemomimi]] shota', with blue-ish black-ish hair, stretching from his animal ears down to his short hair, with [[swept bangs]] and [[short eyebrows]], and [[black eyes]]. He has a [[blue tail|tail]] from which heart-shaped leaves are growing. He's depicted wearing [[round eyewear|round]], [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]] in a [[blue shirt|dark]] [[blue shorts|blue]] [[school uniform]], featuring a [[black bow|black]] [[bowtie]], and a [[single wrist cuff]].

h4. Appearance

h4. External links

* [s]"Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Syotamimi][/s]
* "YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtRAWUYADbQh2nY5r2DP2wA]

title: dancer_(fire_emblem:_three_houses)
body:
The [[dancer]] class as depicted in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

Notably, in contrast to the dancer's depiction in other [[Fire Emblem]] games, the dancer class in [i]Three Houses[/i] has a notable [[ancient greek clothes|Greek]]/[[roman clothes|Roman]]-styled attire as opposed to the [[arabian clothes|Arabian]] style seen in other entries of the series.

The male variation of the dancer outfit in Three Houses consists of a [[tunic]], while the female variation of the dancer outfit in Three Houses consists of a [[single-shoulder dress]]; both attires are usually white for most characters by default. The outfit also includes a [[choker]] around the neck, [[armlet]]s and [[bracelet]]s on the arms, a [[belly chain]] around the waist, and a pair of [[sandals]].

title: hero_(dq10)
body: The [b]Hero[/b] is the protagonist of [[Dragon Quest X]]. He is completely customizable, though his default human appearance tends to have short [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. At the beginning of the game, he loses his human appearance and is granted to opportunity to reclaim it by reincarnating as one of 5 in-universe races: [[Ogre (dq10)|Ogre]], [[Puklipo]], [[Weddie (dq10)|Weddie]], [[Elf (dq10)|Elf]], and [[Dwarf (dq10)|Dwarf]]. He is able to also become a [[demon]] for one arc. His appearance as a separate race is also customizable. [Spoiler] Later in the story, he is revealed to be the son of [[Marone (dq10)|Marone]] and [[Padre (dq10)|Padre]]. [/Spoilers] h4. Official art * !post #9068973: Default Human appearance alongside the [[Heroine_(dq10)|Heroine]] and [[Galapagod]] * !post #8485523: Default Ogre appearance * !post #8421679: Default Elf appearance * !post #9074872: Default Weddie appearance * !post #9074895: Default Dwarf appearance * !post #9074928: Default Puklipo appearance

title: heroine_(dq10)
body: The [b]Heroine[/b] is the female version of the [[Hero (DQ10)|Hero]] that is playable in [[Dragon Quest X]]. Like the Hero, she is completely customizable, though her default human appearance tends to have long [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. At the beginning of the game, she loses her human appearance and is granted to opportunity to reclaim it by reincarnating as one of 5 in-universe races: [[Ogre (dq10)|Ogre]], [[Puklipo]], [[Weddie (dq10)|Weddie]], [[Elf (dq10)|Elf]], and [[Dwarf (dq10)|Dwarf]]. She is able to also become a [[demon]] for one arc. Her appearance as a separate race is also customizable. [Spoiler] Later on in the game's story, she is revealed to be the daughter of [[Marone (dq10)|Marone]] and [[Padre (dq10)|Padre]]. [/Spoiler] h4. Official art * !post #9068973: Default Human appearance alongside the Hero and [[Galapagod]] * !post #8421705: Default Elf appearance * !post #9068931: Default Ogre appearance * !post #8399613: Default Weddie appearance * !post #9074915: Default Dwarf appearance

title: gaplant
body:
A fictional variable geometry [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]].

[b]ORX-005 Gaplant[/b]

A versatile transformable [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]], notably incorporating [[shield]] binders loading [[beam cannon]]s on the arms. The type's limited production run meant very few were dispatched, and only ace pilots such as Cyber-Newtype [[Rosamia Badam]] and the brutal [[Yazan Gable]] were some of the selected few who used the powerful units.

h4.Related MS development
* [[Gaplant Hrairoo]]

title: acid_graphics
body:
Graphic design style that blends the design elements of old school rave flyers with aspects of numerous other styles from the 1990s to the 2020s.

It often uses [[distortion]], grid backgrounds, shapes inspired by [[cyber sigilism]], [[mixed media]] and [[3d]] elements, futuristic fonts, and repeated text.

title: breasts_apart
body:
When the [[breasts]] rest far apart, either due to gravity pulling them apart or due to being physically held apart.

As a rule of thumb, the breasts should point away from each other and the skin over the sternum should be visible.

The opposite of [[cleavage]]. Not for when breasts are too small to touch, or when they don't touch because of something [[between breasts]].

title: woven_hatching
body:
Woven hatching is a shading technique where the artist uses short sets of parallel marks in one direction, then an adjacent group of parallel marks in an almost perpendicular direction to add shade to the art piece.The effect looks woven or like a basket when done well.

Note that this tag is [u]not[/u] mutually exclusive with other subtypes of [[hatching (texture)|hatching]], an artist may use [[linear hatching]] or [[crosshatching]] as well.

h4. Examples

* !asset #25281408: Woven hatching
* !post #7149716
* !post #4331051: Linear hatching, woven hatching and crosshatching.

h4. See also

* [[Hatching (texture)]]
** [[Linear hatching]]
** [[Crosshatching]]

title: inuyasha_(character)
body:
The titular character and main male protagonist of [[InuYasha]]. Has [[dog ears]] due to being half dog youkai.

He  is voiced by [[Yamaguchi Kappei]].

title: saotome_ranma
body:
Title character of [[Ranma 1/2]]. He's an expert martial artist who was born male, but a curse from falling into a magic spring made him turn into a girl ([[Ranma-chan]]). Whenever he gets soaked with cold water he transforms into [[Ranma-chan]] and he changes back when he gets soaked from hot water. He also has an aversion to cats as a result of training in "Cat Fu".

Thanks to his father, he has two fiancés: [[Tendou Akane]] and [[Kuonji Ukyou]]. Is also loved by [[Shampoo (Ranma 1/2)|]]. Seen as rival in love by [[Hibiki Ryouga]], [[Mousse (ranma 1/2)|]] and [[Kunou Tatewaki]].

Family: Father [[Saotome Genma]] and Mother [[Saotome Nodoka]]
He  is voiced by [[Yamaguchi Kappei]].

title: kudou_shin'ichi
body:
The original identity of [[Edogawa Conan]], Shin'ichi is a high-school detective who was forced to take a poison that should have killed him, but unexpectedly shrunk him into a child. He secretly pursues the Black Organization that caused this in order to heal his deformity and to bring them to justice. There are occasions when Shin'ichi returns to his regular age in order to fool his childhood friend [[Mouri Ran]] so she doesn't think he's either dead or is Conan.

His name comes from fictional detective [[Kudou Shunsaku (tantei monogatari)|]] and science fiction writer [[Hoshi Shin'ichi]].

He  is voiced by [[Yamaguchi Kappei]].

title: reverse:1999
body:
[b]Reverse:1999[/b] is a mobile RPG from Chinese developer Bluepoch. The game has gained notability as, unlike most Chinese gacha games, whose casts are voiced by Japanese or Chinese voice actors, the cast of Reverse:1999 is voiced by British voice actors who (with one or two exceptions) speak in English.

title: king_boo
body:
The king of all [[Boo (mario)|]]s in the [[Mario (series)|]] series. He debuted in [[Luigi's Mansion]], where he served as the main villain and final boss.

Since then, he has appeared in numerous Mario spinoff games (such as [[Mario Kart]]) and has reprised his role as the villain in [[Luigi's Mansion: Dark Moon]] and [[Luigi's Mansion 3]]. He is often shown as [[Luigi]]'s main nemesis, much like [[Bowser]] vs. [[Mario]].

title: cyber_sigilism
body: A tattooing and graphic design style often in thin and sharp, bold blackwork. It generally pulls inspiration from ancient tribal designs and abstract art, often with a cyber-dystopian twist. Running themes are technology, mysticism and symbols.

title: suzuhara_touji
body:
A male character from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]].

He is the Fourth Children selected to be the pilot of  [[eva_03|Evangelion Unit 03]]. At school he is said to act like a tough boy and stereotypical jock. He is friends with [[Aida Kensuke]], [[Horaki Hikari]], and [[Ikari Shinji]].

He  is voiced by [[Seki Tomokazu]].

title: takasugi_shinsuke
body:

Modeled after Takasugi Shinsaku.
He  is voiced by [[Koyasu Takehito]].

title: yoshida_shouyou
body:
A character from [i][[Gintama]][/i], modeled after "Yoshida Shouin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshida_Sh%C5%8Din].

The teacher at the dojo [[Sakata Gintoki]], [[Katsura Kotarou]], and [[Takasugi Shinsuke]] all attended when they were younger. Mentor and father figure to all three. 
He  is voiced by [[Yamadera Kouichi]].

[spoiler] He is decapitated during the Joi War by Gintoki himself, but turns out to be immortal and survives as [[Utsuro]]. The identity of "Yoshida Shouyou" is not his true self.[/spoiler]

title: franklin_(azur_lane)
body:
A personification of the [i]Essex[/i]-class carrier USS [i]Franklin[/i] (CV-13). Franklin has the dubious honor of suffering the highest loss of life among any US warship that wasn't sunk, and the second-highest loss of life of any USN ship after the Arizona, due to heavy damage from an enemy dive bomber attack near the end of the war. Along with Bunker Hill, severely damaged by kamikaze attack, Franklin saw no active-duty service after the end of [[World War II]].

h4. Skins

title: repulse_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of HMS [i]Repulse[/i].

She has [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of with a [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], a white [[capelet]], [[white boots|white]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[crop top]] that leaves her with an exposed [[midriff]]. 

She is one of three ships the player starts the game with, alongside the player's selected starter ship and [[Long Island (Azur Lane)|]]. Her skill activation phrase, "Neratte Pon~," is well known for this reason.

Historically, HMS [i]Repulse[/i] was completed shortly after the Battle of Jutland, but had a fairly unremarkable history until the outbreak of the Second World War. In November 1941 the Royal Navy sent her and [[Prince of Wales (Azur Lane)|Prince of Wales]], alongside other vessels, to reinforce Singapore against Japanese attack. After the Attack on Pearl Harbor, the two were famously sunk by a large air attack by Japanese bombers, their air defences insufficient to stave off the assault.

h4. Skins

title: forsen
body: Sebastian "Forsen" Fors is a popular Swedish [[twitch.tv|Twitch]] streamer. He initially gained widespread recognition within the [[StarCraft II]] and later the [[Hearthstone]] communities. He is now primarily known as a variety streamer, often playing games like [[PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds]] (PUBG) and [[Minecraft]], and for his highly engaged and meme-centric community, often referred to as "Bajs" or "Forsenboys".

title: kotomine_kirei_(sensha_otoko)
body:

title: enkidu_(sensha_otoko)_(fate)
body:
[[Enkidu (fate)|]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke for 2009. In this universe, Enkidu is not a [[1other|genderless entity]], but an actual girl who uses the handle name "Enkidu-chan" online. She has a crush on [[gilgamesh (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Gil"]] and always hangs out with him.

* !post #3867362

title: diarmuid_ua_duibhne_(sensha_otoko)_(fate)
body:
[[diarmuid ua duibhne (lancer) (fate)|Diarmuid Ua Duibhne]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke of 2009. In this universe, he is the elder son of the El-Melloi family, and [[waver velvet (sensha otoko)|"El-Melloi Girl"]] is his younger sister whom he adores.

* !post #3746884

title: waver_velvet_(sensha_otoko)
body:
[[Waver Velvet]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke for 2009. Here, he has [[genderswap (mtf)|become a girl]] named "El-Melloi Girl", and is the main heroine. She lives with her family - Papa El-Melloi, Mama El-Melloi, and [[diarmuid ua duibhne (sensha otoko) (fate)|Big Brother]]. [[iskandar (sensha otoko) (fate)|"Sensha Otoko"]] falls in love with her, but is too shy to approach her.

Since El-Melloi Girl is a female version of Waver, she wears a skirt and thighhighs in place of pants.

* !post #1023712

title: iskandar_(sensha_otoko)_(fate)
body:
[[Iskandar (fate)|]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke for 2009. In this universe, he is only known by his web-board username "Sensha Otoko" ("Tank Man"). He is incredibly shy and cannot get a girlfriend, but falls in love with a girl known as [[waver velvet (sensha otoko)|"El-Melloi Girl"]]. Sensha Otoko asks for romantic advice from his online buddies on Eirei Throne-Channel.

Sensha Otoko looks slightly different from Iskandar in that his hair is messier, and he wears [[glasses]].

* !post #1521074

title: medea_(sensha_otoko)_(fate)
body:
[[Medea (caster) (fate)|]] as depicted in the [[Sensha Otoko]] April Fools joke for 2009. In this universe, Medea uses her own name as her online pseudonym. She is a former model betrayed by her boyfriend (implied to be [[Kuzuki Souichirou]]) and continues obsessing over him. [[sasaki kojirou (sensha otoko) (fate)|Sasaki Kojirou]] is her caretaker.

title: squid_game
body:
A South Korean survival drama series on [[Netflix]]. 

The first season aired worldwide on September 17, 2021. The second season aired on December 26, 2024. A third season is expected to release in 2025.

The story revolves around [[Seong Gi-hun]], a debt-ridden gambling addict who was invited to the "Squid Game" tournament to play a series of children's games to win a huge amount of cash. He is taken to an unknown location along with 455 other people with financial issues. They later find out that the disqualified participants get killed, as well as face physical and psychological twists of the game itself.

Note: The [[green track suit]] the characters wore in the series is a very common style of Asian school uniform. Please do not tag [[Squid Game]] on any similar instance of the track suit, such as the [[meme attire]] [[China tracksuit]].

h4. Characters

title: warhammer_40k
body:
[quote][i]In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only war.[/i] - promotional slogan[/quote]

A tabletop miniature wargame produced by Games Workshop since 1987, set in a bleak, war-torn [[science fiction]] and  [[fantasy]] universe. The setting has spawned numerous novels, games and movie adaptations.

Its tagline became the namesake for the grimdark genre of works of fiction as bleakly dystopian as WH40K or sometimes even more so.

title: emperor_of_mankind
body:
One of the most important characters in the [[warhammer_40k|Warhammer 40,000]] universe, the God-Emperor of Mankind is a figure seen as the divine ruler of all humanity. He united a fractured Terra (in ancient times also known as [[earth_(planet)|Earth]]) following the collapse of mankind's previous civilization before setting out on a galaxy-wide campaign (known as the Great Crusade) to reunite lost human worlds and reclaim his demigod sons known as Primarchs.

One, [[horus_lupercal|Horus]], would betray him and rally half the Primarchs to the cause of [[chaos_(warhammer)|Chaos]], triggering a civil war. The Emperor would slay Horus, but was mortally wounded in turn and encased upon a life-support device known as the Golden Throne, where mankind would quickly worship him as a god.

Generally depicted in 2 forms:
* During the Great Crusade, as a very tall human wearing a extremely decorated [[gold armor|golden]]  [[power armor]], a golden [[laurel crown]] and long [[claws|talons]] on a hand, and holding a [[flaming sword]]. See post #1037362.
* After the Horus Heresy, sitting on the Golden Throne, usually as a corpse. See post #5024924.

title: revealing_chastity_cage
body:
A [[chastity cage]] design that lets you see the [[penis]] inside the chastity cage. Use this tag if

* A [[metal chastity cage]] is made of rings around the penis.
* A metal or plastic cage has an open frame or mesh.
* Small wires connect at the tip revealing the tip of the penis.
* A cage is made out of metal and leather straps that don't cover most of the penis.

If the penis is hidden by an enclosed tube, use [[tube chastity cage]] instead.

Do not use this tag if the only openings are breathing holes or the space between the ring and the tube.

This tag can be combined with [[tube chastity cage]] or [[nub chastity cage]] when the tip of the penis is revealed by wires.

h4. Correct examples

* Post #7345733 [tn]NSFW | Ringed chastity cage.[/tn]
* Post #3662299 [tn]NSFW | Wires connecting at the tip / birdcage type.[/tn]
* Post #3850868 [tn]NSFW | Metal frame.[/tn]
* Post #8259583 [tn]NSFW | Plastic frame / cobra type.[/tn]
* Post #8495414 [tn]NSFW | [[nub chastity cage]] with wires connecting at the tip.[/tn]

title: taguel
body:
The Taguel is a race introduced in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].  

Similar in nature to the manakete (dragon) race, taguel typically inhabit a weaker human-like body and temporarily transform into a giant beast similar to a a monster bunny in battle using the power of their beaststones. The taguel race has been long persecuted and abused by humans and driven to the brink of extinction, and by the time of Awakening the last living taguel is [[panne (fire emblem)|Panne]].

[spoiler][[yarne (fire emblem)| Yarne]] as the son of [[panne (fire emblem)|Panne]] makes them the only two known living taguels. [/spoiler]

title: left_4_dead
body:
A team-based first-person [[zombie]] shooter first developed by Turtle Rock Studios before being acquired by [[Valve Software]] to also work on the game together. It is set in 2008 after a viral pandemic which turns people into mutated, violent creatures hellbent on attacking uninfected humans.

The gameplay focuses on cooperating with your teammates to get to safety at the end of each map. There is also a team-based Versus Mode where up to 8 players compete against each other in teams of 4, Survivors and Infected, to see who can get the most points to win.

Was followed up by [[Left 4 Dead 2]].

h4. External links
* Wikipedia entry: "Left 4 Dead":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Left_4_Dead]

title: personification
body:
When objects or non-humanoid characters ([[animal]]s, [[creature]]s, [[non-humanoid robot]]s etc.) are transformed into humans or humanoids.

Use [[humanization]] instead if a humanoid character ([[humanoid robot]]s, [[furry|furries]] etc.) is turned into a human.

[b]Do not use this tag on copyrights revolving around personifications[/b], unless the image explicitly shows them as a personification (such as [[creature and personification]] posts). This includes [[Kantai Collection]], [[Azur Lane]], [[Warship Girls R]], [[Umamusume]], [[Touken Ranbu]], [[Girls' Frontline]], [[Axis Powers Hetalia]], and others (see: topic #10067).

title: dragon_girl
body:
A female character with a dragon-like appearance.

For actual dragons, use the [[dragon]] tag instead (though there may or may not be overlap if [[personification]]/[[humanization]] is at play).

A particularly famous kind of dragon girl (or boy) is the [[Fire Emblem]] "manakete" or "mamkute" (マムクート); the games typically include at least one such character, often playable, who can transform from a human form into a full dragon, with the prominence of draconic features varying between each example. For ease of sorting, a separate "manakete" tag should not be made and all such characters should be sorted into the appropriate dragon-person tag.

h4. See also

* [[dragon boy]]
* [[dragon ears]]
* [[dragon horns]]
* [[dragon tail]]
* [[dragon wings]]

title: reference_sheet
body:
An image depicting the details of a design. A reference sheet usually consists of [[multiple views]] of the same subject from different angles, with notes [[pointing out the details]] of the design, and sometimes with details such as clothing or accessories drawn separately for characters. The image often has the character with certain [[clothes on and off]].

For characters depicted in the same pose but in different clothing (as in post #1580637), use [[variations]].

This tag is for reference sheets of any subject. Use the [[weapon focus]] and [[vehicle focus]] tags alongside this one when appropriate.

h4. Examples

* !post #3705812

h4. See also

* [[character profile]]

title: sonic_adventure
body:
[b]Sonic Adventure[/b] (ソニックアドベンチャー [i]Sonikku Adobenchā[/i]) is a video game created by [[Sonic Team]] and released on 23 December [[1998]] in Japan for the [[sega dreamcast|Sega Dreamcast]] and the first main Sonic the Hedgehog game to feature 3D gameplay.

The story follows [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]], [[Tails (Sonic)|]], [[Knuckles the Echidna|Knuckles]], [[Amy Rose]], newcomers [[Big the Cat]] and [[E-102 Gamma]], in their quests to collect the seven [[Chaos Emerald]]s and stop series antagonist [[Dr. Eggman|Dr. Robotnik]] from unleashing [[Chaos (Sonic)|Chaos]], an ancient evil. Controlling one of the six characters, with each with their own special abilities, players explore a series of themed levels to progress through the story.

It received a sequel in [[2001]], [[Sonic Adventure 2]], marking the 10th anniversary of the Sonic the Hedgehog series. In [[2003]], it received an enhanced port for the [[Gamecube|Nintendo GameCube]] and [[computer|PC]] titled [b]Sonic Adventure DX: Director's Cut[/b] (or [b]Deluxe[/b] in Japan).

h4. External links
* "Sonic Retro: Sonic Adventure":https://info.sonicretro.org/Sonic_Adventure

title: uta_no_prince-sama
body:
A Japanese multimedia franchise about male idols by [[broccoli_(company)|Broccoli]], originally starting with an otome game published in 2010 and since then has spawned multiple sequels and rhythm game spin-offs, with the most notable being [[Uta no Prince-sama: Shining Live]]. It has since received a manga and a 2011 anime with a second season in 2012, a third in 2014, a fourth in 2016, and a movie in 2019. 
It is considered one of the foremost franchises in the male [[idol]] genre and has retained its fame both in Japan and worldwide for more than a decade. 

The original plot line followed the heroine [[Nanami Haruka]]’s life in Saotome Academy, a prestigious performing arts school made up of students who are either vying to become an idol or a music producer, as she chases after her dream of becoming a composer and someday writing a song for her favorite idol HAYATO. Haruka becomes acquainted with six of her classmates, who are all competing to become idols. For her project, she must team up with another student as an idol-producer team, and if they are successful, they will join Shining Agency after graduation.  

The franchise features three idol groups: the main group [[STARISH|ST★RISH]], [[QUARTET NIGHT]] - a band made up of the seniors of ST★RISH in the 2013 game [i]Uta no Prince-sama: All Star[/i], and HE★VENS - an anime-only idol group introduced in [[uta_no_prince-sama_maji_love_2000_percent|Uta no Prince-sama: Maji Love 2000%]] and not seen before in the games who become rivals to ST★RISH

h4. Characters

h6. Heroine

title: pokemon
body:
[ [[list_of_pokemon_media|media]] | [[list_of_pokemon_characters|people]] | [[list_of_pokemon|creatures]] | [[list_of_pokemon_objects|objects]] | [[list_of_pokemon_places|places]] | [[list_of_pokemon_moves|moves]] | [[list_of_pokemon_abilities|abilities]] | [[pool group:pokemon|pools]] | [[help:pokemon tags|help]] ]

Pokémon (ポケットモンスター, [i]Pocket Monsters[/i]) is a highly popular [[tag group:role-playing games|RPG series]] developed by Tajiri Satoshi, with art by [[Sugimori Ken]], for [[Nintendo]] handheld video game devices since 1996, and has since spawned several spinoff games, [[pokemon adventures|manga]], and [[pokemon (anime)|an anime series]].

In the main games, the player character goes on a journey through various cities, towns and landscape (caves, forests, sea, etc.) and meets creatures known as [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]]. The player is able to collect Pokémon to form a personalized team, train them to make them stronger, choose their known skills and command them to fight against other Pokémon. People who do that are Pokémon Trainers. Many NPCs are Pokémon Trainers available to fight against the player.

The storyline advances as the player gains eight [[gym_leader_badge|badges]] for defeating different Gym Leaders and eventually challenges the Elite Four and the current Champion; defeating them all grants the player the title of Champion for himself/herself. Typical side quests, such as finding a specific item or person, are also required at certain points. Additionally, the player repeatedly fights against his or her personal rivals and routinely clashes with a criminal organization.

h4. Tagging

See [[help:pokemon tags|Help:Pokémon tags]].

h4. See also

* [[list_of_pokemon|List of Pokémon]]
* [[list_of_pokemon_characters|List of Pokémon Characters]]
* [[list_of_pokemon_objects|List of Pokémon Objects]]
* [[list_of_pokemon_media|List of Pokémon Media]]
* [[pool group:pokemon|Pool group:Pokémon]]
* [[pokemon battle|Pokémon Battle]]
* [[poke ball theme|Poké Ball theme]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon
* "Official Site (Japan)":http://www.pokemon.co.jp
* "Official Site (USA)":http://www.pokemon.com

title: pencil_dress
body:
A close-fitting [[dress]] with a straight, narrow cut. Generally the hemline ranges from skirt length to miniskirt length, and is tailored for a close fit.

The difference between a [[pencil dress]] and a [[tube dress]] is that a [[tube dress]] is always [[strapless]]. A [[pencil dress]] can have straps or a [[halterneck]], and is applicable to all non-strapless dresses with a tight-fitting lower half.

[[Hestia (danmachi)|]]'s white dress is an example of a pencil dress, due to the skirt portion of her dress fitting tightly around/below her hips.

title: longcat_(meme)
body:
[i]Longcat is looooooong.[/i]

An exceptionally long, female [[white cat]] that became an internet [[meme]]. The original photo features her owner [[holding animal|holding her]] in an [[armpit carry]], demonstrating her length.

Her real name was [[Shiro (cat)|]] (シロ, lit. "White"), a stray cat found in the streets and adopted by her human. On [[2channel]], she was known as Nobiiru (のびーる, from [i]nobiru[/i], which means to stretch or extend). On [[4chan]] and the western Internet, she was known as Longcat.

She died on "September 20, 2020.":[https://twitter.com/aerosubaru/status/1307553093681209345] ("Archive of Tweet":https://web.archive.org/web/20200920053331/https://twitter.com/aerosubaru/status/1307553093681209345)

h4. Examples

title: maximum_overdrive
body:
Maximum Overdrive is a 1986 American horror film written and directed by Stephen King, in his only directorial effort. The film stars Emilio Estevez, Pat Hingle, Laura Harrington, and Yeardley Smith. The screenplay was inspired by and loosely based on King's short story "Trucks", which was included in the author's first collection of short stories, Night Shift, and follows the events after all machines (including trucks, radios, arcade games, vending machines, etc.) become sentient when Earth crosses the tail of a comet, initiating a worldwide killing spree.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximum_Overdrive

It has also been adapted into a manga series, featuring art by Takeru Kirishima and serialized in the CompAce magazine, published 2005.

title: last_origin
body:
A Korean turn-based mobile strategy RPG developed by Sigma Works and published by Smartjoy, launched in January 2019. A Japanese version launched in 2020. There has been no recent news on a release date for an English-language global version .

The game's setting is a world where human civilization has crumbled. The remaining human survivors work together with [[Auto Guard System]] robots and artificial humans called Bioroids to defend the planet against the [[Ironworm]]s, alien parasites of unknown origin.

Became popular (as well as infamous) in the Korean community, thanks to its many [[revealing_clothes|suggestive]] character designs during its introduction by regular artists such as [[snowball22|Snowball]] and [[Kakiman]], as well as collab artists [[Asanagi]] and [[Obui]]. After the uncensored version's re-rating to adult only in Korea around August 2024, the game has since introduced numerous sexually explicit character design and skins.

h4. See also

* [[List of Last Origin characters]]

h4. External links

* "Official Website":http://smartjoy-game.com/LastOrigin

title: laputa_robot
body:
An iconic [[robot]] from the movie [[Tenkuu no Shiro Laputa|Laputa: Castle in the Sky]]. It has a peaked head with mismatched sockets for eyes (one small, one large), a large chest curving down to a small hip, and flat, segmented limbs. Its arms are long enough to extend down to the ground and each segment also has [[spines]]. It has an earthy, metallic color (grey or dark brown).

The Japanese term for the robot is literally "robot soldier", though a non-military type has also been shown. This one lacks spines and has a more greener color.

title: stand_(jojo)
body:
Refers to the "Stand" powers in [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]], which typically are portrayed as ghost-like projections of a person's psyche or fighting spirit. The special powers vary widely, such as the ability to [[the fool (stand)|control sand]] or summon a [[silver chariot|sword-wielding warrior]]. They first appear in Part 3 of the manga, with the powers becoming increasingly more complex and abstract as the series goes on.

In Part 3 the first group of Stands are named after the Major Arcana of [[tarot|Tarot cards]] (such as [[Star Platinum]] and [[Hierophant Green]]). As the story continues the new enemy Stands are named after Egyptian gods (such as [[Anubis (stand)|]] and [[Horus (stand)|]]). Near the end some Stands are named after western music groups (such as [[Cream (stand)|]]).

From Part 4 onwards, the vast majority of the Stands' names are named after various western music groups, albums, and songs (such as [[Killer Queen]], [[Aerosmith (stand)|]], [[Foo Fighters (jojo)|]], and [[20th Century Boy (Stand)|]]).

Although usually featured with their "Stand User", it is not uncommon for Stands to be featured by themselves or with other people in fanart. An increasingly common example is [[Dio Brando]]'s Stand [[The World]], which is often featured with [[Touhou]]'s [[Izayoi Sakuya]].

h4. List of tagged Stands

title: angel
body:
Spiritual beings usually viewed as messengers and guardians to living beings, typically originated from [[heaven]].

Their appearance varies culturally and characteristically, but the common popular depiction is based on the medieval stylization of a humanoid with [[white wings|white]] [[angel wings]] and a [[halo]].

h4. Notable angel characters

* [[Amane Kanata]] from [[Hololive]]
* [[Angel Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]] from [[Chainsaw Man]]
* [[Azazel (helltaker)|]] from [[Helltaker]]
* [[Cassie (acerailgun)|]], original character by Acerailgun
* [[Crimvael]] from [[Ishuzoku Reviewers]]
* [[Nanael (queen's blade)|]] from [[Queen's Blade]]
* [[Pekora (jashin-chan dropkick)|]] from [[Jashin-chan Dropkick]]
* [[Gabriel Tenma White]], [[Raphiel Shiraha Ainsworth]] and [[Tapris Chisaki Sugarbell]] from [[Gabriel Dropout]]

h4. See also

* [[cherub]]
* [[seraph]]
* [[angel wings]]
* [[angel and devil]]
* [[biblically accurate angel]]
* [[Tag group:Legendary creatures]]

title: subarashii_pose
body:
Stock mad scientist pose in Japanese media. Both palms open and turned skyward, with [[outstretched arms|arms outstretched]] and raised slightly in a confident, 'welcoming' gesture. Arms may sometimes be raised higher above the head. Legs usually remain standing, spread apart slightly (though some may have them close together as if standing at attention).

Often accompanied with the stock exclamation of "SUBARASHII", hence the name. This is usually translated into English as "magnificent" [tn](c.f. [[Bondrewd]])[/tn], "majestic" [tn](c.f. [[micolash_host_of_the_nightmare|Micolash]])[/tn], "marvelous"  [tn](also [[Bondrewd]])[/tn], "wonderful", "magnifique", etc.

Mad scientists in Western works may also sometimes strike a similar pose, but this is far less common, as they tend to prefer other more intimidating poses.

The standard Western equivalent generally involves one arm raised and clenched in a claw-like pose, with the other raised higher and 'pointed' towards the general direction of the viewer or another character. This second arm can be either 'open' or clenched closed, and is usually also holding another object: generally a test tube, flask, ray gun, wrench, or some other 'sciencey' implement.

h4. Examples

* !post #4239158

title: bondrewd
body:
An antagonist from [[Made in Abyss]]. Bondrewd "[i]The Novel[/i]", also known as "[i]The Lord of Dawn"/"The Sovereign of Dawn[/i]", is a legendary white whistle delver who has made many great discoveries about the secrets of the Abyss.

Bondrewd is a tall man often seen wearing a black [[overcoat]], a [[black suit]] and a black [[helm]]. His signature pose is the [[subarashii pose]], due to his tendency to strike this peculiar stance whenever he finds something interesting.

h4. See also
* "Made in Abyss Wiki : Bondrewd":http://madeinabyss.wikia.com/wiki/Bondrewd

title: tattoo_sleeve
body: A sleeve tattoo or tattoo sleeve is a large [[tattoo]] or collection of smaller, usually connected tattoos that covers most or all of a person's arm or leg. While a 'full' sleeve will cover the entire arm from shoulder to wrist or entire leg from groin to ankle, there are also 'half' and 'quarter' sleeves which cover less, but will still typically envelop the entire arm just as a garment would.

title: miller_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the destroyer USS [i]Miller[/i] (DD-535). 

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[grey hair|grey]]-[[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]] and tied into [[twintails]], and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black tank top]], [[off shoulder]] [[black jacket]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt]], [[black thighhighs]] (left one is [[torn thighhighs|torn]]), and [[black boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two separate hull pieces, one with 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]] and another with a 127 mm gun mount.

title: halford_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the destroyer USS [i]Halford[/i] (DD-480), as part of the [i][[World of Warships]][/i] collaboration. While having existed in real life, she is depicted in her original 1943 experimental configuration as an aircraft-carrying destroyer.

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] done in [[twintails]], and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[layered dress|two-layer]] [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white pantyhose]], black [[frilled hairband]] containing her [[headphones]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life aircraft catapult to her right and her real-life forward 533 mm quintuple [[torpedo tubes]] to her left. Her planes are [[F8F Bearcat]]s armed with Tiny Tim rockets that has floats applied for scouting and attacking purposes, launched from a teddy bear familiar to her back.

In real life, she received an [[aircraft catapult]] for a float plane in place of her aft torpedo mount and one of her main guns, allowing the ship to launch a Kingfisher scout observation plane. The catapult turned out not to be operationally suitable for the intended purpose and was ultimately removed from Halford in October 1943. However, in World of Warships, she get her catapult back while having her AA Defenses upgraded and she participated during Leyte Gulf. The Aircraft she carried are Floatplane versions of the [[F8F Bearcat]]s.

title: bache_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the American destroyer [i]Bache[/i].
Character design by [[waterkuma]], voiced by Kaneko Sayaka.

h4. Appearance and personality
Her design as well as her personality were based on a [[pun]] of her name that reads almost the same as the word "bitch". As such, she is depicted as a "[[mesugaki]]" [[gyaru]]. She has a [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[two side up]] and a [[purple eyes]], she wears a [[black_headwear|black]] [[sailor hat]] with golden anchor decoration, a golden [[fur trim]]med [[jacket]], a [[black_shirt|black]] [[sleeveless]] [[crop top]] [[serafuku]] with a yellow ribbon, a [[pink collar]] with a golden ring, and a [[short shorts|very short]] [[denim shorts]]. 

h4. Skins
* !post #3611916: Default
* !post #3639441: [[Bache (Gorgeous Speed-Star) (Azur Lane)|Gorgeous Speed-Star]]
* !post #3836610: [[Bache (Showy Sports Star) (Azur Lane)|Showy Sports Star]]

h4. History
The historical [i]Bache[/i] was launched in 7 July 1942. After being assigned to several bombardment mission in late 1943, she took part in the "Battle of Surigao Strait":/pools/9549 before sent back to the United States in late 1944 for her first overhaul. After completion, she was sent to cover fire support at [[Iwo Jima]] before being struck by a kamikaze attack on 13 May 1945, forcing her to return to the US and receive her second overhaul. After the war, she has been converted two times, first in 1950 as an escort destroyer, before being converted back into a destroyer in 1962.  On 6 Febuary 1968, [i]Bache[/i] was stuck by a gale during her visit on the Isle of Rhodes, Greece, and ran aground. Ironically for the in-game emphasis on her character, the US Navy deemed her unrecoverable and she was sold for scrap there.

* "Azur Lane Wiki: Bache":[https://azurlane.koumakan.jp/Bache]

title: santa_fe_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the US Navy light cruiser USS [i]Santa Fe[/i] (CL-60). Character design by [[Namyo]]. 

In-game, she has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with a [[blue headband]] and tied into [[low twintails]] with [[star hair ornament]]s, and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of an [[off shoulder]] [[white coat]], [[blue apron]] with multiple ties, sleeveless [[white sweater]] with [[breast curtains]], [[blue panties|blue]] [[side-tie panties]], [[red boots|red]] [[single thigh boot]] on her left leg with her name printed on it, and blue [[arm warmers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the [i]Cleveland[/i]-class: two hull pieces with two 152 mm triple gun mounts and two 127 mm twin gun mounts. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #9059610: Default outfit
* !post #9059645: [[santa_fe_(the_rumor_mill_never_sleeps)_(azur_lane)|The Rumor Mill Never Sleeps]] - patient

title: akemi_(blue_archive)
body:
A non-playable character from [[Blue Archive]]. 

Ex-Leader of the Sukebans, and one of the Seven Prisoners. Known as "The Legendary Sukeban".
The academy she hails from is unknown, but there was a specific incident where numerous vehicles were destroyed and several students injured by her and her alone.

Her full name is Kurihama Akemi.

She has a [[tall]], [[muscular female|muscular]] figure with [[long hair|long]], [[blonde hair|blonde]], [[wavy hair]] resting [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulder]].

Her attire is a parody of [[Geese Howard]] from [[Fatal Fury]].
She wears a [[sarashi]] that covers her [[medium breasts]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[red gloves]], a [[studded belt]], the bottom half of a [[red serafuku]], and [[high heels]].

The three lines of text on her skirt are translated as:
* First line: "[i]The bloodthirsty old woman said she's the upper demon of the sand.[/i]"
* 2nd line: "[i]To be invincible in this world, one must heed the old woman’s words.[/i]"
* 3rd line:  "[i]I defy death and conquer fire, my power is overwhelming.[/i]"

But it can also be read as:
* First line: "[i]The very best young lady.[/i]"
* 2nd line: "[i]The invincible sukeban.[/i]"
* 3rd line:  "[i]I'm cute.[/i]"

Her weapons of choice are a [[Browning M2]] [[heavy machine gun]] and an [[M202 FLASH]] [[rocket launcher]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7919987: Profile

title: wakamo_(blue_archive)
body:
A playable character from [[Blue Archive]].

One of the "Seven Prisoners" that escaped from the Corrections Bureau. Known as the "Fox of Calamity" (災厄の狐).
Formerly from Hyakkiyako Alliance Academy before being suspended.
She is an arsonist and terrorist who loves to cause of chaos and destruction wherever she goes, and even rallies others students to join her.
She also has a strong affection (borderline obsession) for [[Sensei_(blue_archive)|Sensei]].

Her full name is [b]Kosaka Wakamo[/b].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a [[multicolored hair|hint]] or [[red hair|red]], [[yellow eyes]], [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]] adorned with a [[tail ribbon]].
She's dressed in a [[black kimono]] with a [[floral print]], a [[flower choker]], [[high heel boots]] with a [[torn_thighhighs|torn]] [[single thighhigh]], and a [[fox mask]] that makes her eyes [[glowing_eyes|glow]] [[red eyes|red]].

Uses an [[Arisaka]]-type [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] with a [[tassel]] decorated [[bayonet]].

Voiced by: [[Saitou Chiwa]]
Original artist: [[NAMYO]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #5634085: Default
* !post #6339744: [[Wakamo (Swimsuit) (blue archive)|Swimsuit]]

h4. External links

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Wakamo":[https://bluearchive.wiki/wiki/Wakamo]
other_names: ワカモ(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: bowtie
body:
A [[bow]] that is tied to the neck. Often seen on school uniforms (usually for females).

A more [[traditional_bowtie|traditional]] style is commonly seen in formal male clothing such as a [[tuxedo]], and in [[playboy bunny]] outfits (usually attached to a [[detached collar]]).

Not to be confused with a [[neck ribbon]] which lacks the volume of the [[bowtie]].

h4. Examples

* !post #4290824: Bowtie with loose ends
* !post #5638657: Bowtie without loose ends
* !asset #25361475: Bowties resemble a butterfly or two triangles

h4. Non examples

* !post #7700874: [[Neck ribbon]]. Looks thinner than a bowtie. Often with a japanese bow knot
* !post #8567560: [[Ribbon choker]]. Wraps tightly around the neck and has direct contact with the skin
* !post #4867149: [[Neckerchief]]. A piece of cloth resembling a necktie, there is no bow.

h4. Colors

title: kai_(blue_archive)
body:
A non-playable character from [[Blue Archive]]. 

The former President of Shanhaijing's Eastern Alchemy Society. She was expelled for performing dangerous experiments that harmed or even killed students.

She is one of the Seven Prisoners of Kivotos, Known as the "Five Dust Macaque" (五塵の彌猴).

Her full name is [b]Shintani Kai[/b].

Has [[white hair|white]] & [[black hair|black]] [[split-color hair]] of [[medium hair|medium length]], [[crossed bangs]], and [[grey eyes]] with [[white pupils]].
She wears a [[lab coat|white labcoat]] and [[black dress|black]] [[china dress]] with a [[cleavage]] [[cleavage cutout|cutout]] that exposes her [[large breasts]], [[black gloves]], [[thighhighs]], and [[high heels]].

Her weapon of choice is a [[type 54 black star]] [[handgun|pistol]].

title: akira_(blue_archive)
body:
A non-playable character from [[Blue Archive]]. 

A master thief who is infamous for stealing priceless artifacts and artwork.
The academy she originally belongs to is currently unknown.

She is one of the Seven Prisoners of Kivotos, Known as the "Phantom Thief of Affection" (慈愛の怪盗).
Unlike the other prisoners, none of her crimes were non-violent. Instead, Akira's M.O is her leaving behind a calling card with a cryptic message about what she intends to steal, and how she will pull it off. And by the time someone has figured it out, she and the stolen treasure are long gone.

Her full name is [b]Kiyosumi Akira[/b].

She has [[long hair|long]], [[white|]], [[wavy hair]] that's tied into a [[half updo]], [[pink eyes]], [[cat ears]], and a [[cat tail]]
Aside from the [[blue ribbon]], she is clad in top to bottom in white:
* a [[white shirt|white]] [[poet shirt]] with a [[frilled sleeves]].
* a [[white cloak]] and a [[white mask|white]] [[domino mask]].
* a pair of [[white pants]] with a [[white belt]] and [[high heels]].

Her weapons of choice is a Remington 1866 pistol and a [[cane gun]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24164402: Profile

Not to be confused with a [[bowtie]], which has more volume and is usually shorter.

Not to be confused with a [[ribbon choker]], which is a ribbon tied around the neck as a choker.

title: ouro_kronii_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Ouro Kronii]].

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and a [[white sailor collar]], worn over a [[black shirt|black]] [[pinstripe shirt|pinstripe]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[cropped shirt|shirt]] with a golden [[zipper]] that reveals her [[underboob]], a [[blue bowtie]] with a [[heart brooch]] with a  [[heart-shaped gem]], black/dark grey [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[juliet sleeves]], [[black gloves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[pinstripe_skirt|pinstripe]] [[half-skirt|half]] [[miniskirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[blue boots|blue]]  [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[ankle boots]]. She also has small [[bow earrings]], an optional [[blue cape]], and a pair of [[sword]]s styled after clock hands.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4724270: Reference sheet

title: ouro_kronii_(casual)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Ouro Kronii]].

It consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[turtleneck]] [[white shirt]] with [[shoulder cutout]]s (although some fans depict it as a [[sleeveless turtleneck]] with [[detached sleeves]] due to her being able to swap her top for a sleeveless turtleneck), [[high-waist pants|high-waist]] [[blue pants|blue]] [[jeans]] that she can swat her jeans with a pair of [[blue shorts|blue]] [[dolphin shorts]], a [[brown coat|brown]] [[trench coat]], and [[white shoes|white]] [[high heels]]. She now has a pair of [[ear piercing]]s on her right ear and her [[halo]] is now much smaller and is styled after an electronic clock. She also has an optional [[handbag]] with a [[Boros (Ouro Kronii)|]] [[keyring]] [[bag charm]]. 

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this attire is [[long hair]] is [[hime cut]]-esque  with [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[center-flap bangs]] and long [[sidelocks]] with [[blunt ends]], with her [[hair intakes]] being placed closer together.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #15444697: Profile

* !post #6713058: Merchandise

body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Ouro Kronii]].

It is a [[military uniform]] consisting of a [[black coat|black]] [[long coat]] [[coat on shoulders|draped over her shoulders]], a [[two-tone jacket|two tone]] [[black jacket|black]] and [[blue jacket|blue]] [[military jacket]] with a [[two-tone vest|two-tone]] [[black vest|black]] and [[blue vest|blue]] [[waistcoat]] and a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[blue necktie]] and [[mismatched sleeves|mismatched]] [[white sleeves|white]] and [[blue sleeves|blue]] [[detached sleeves]] underneath, [[black pants]] with a [[thigh strap]] and [[black boots]]. She also has an [[ear chain]] on her right ear and a [[chain earrings|chain earring]] on her left, [[white gloves]]. The pants' legs are [[detached pants|detachable]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] for this outfit is [[medium hair|medium]]/[[long hair]] [[two-tone hair]] with [[colored tips]] in a [[wolf cut]], with [[sidelocks]] and her [[hair intakes]] closer together.

h4. Appearance

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her [[long hair|long]] [[messy hair]] tied into [[low twintails|low twin]] [[low twin braids|braids]] [[hair over shoulder|hanging over her shoulders]] and her signature [[hair intakes]] with [[fanged bangs]].

title: ariyoshi_juna
body:
有吉 樹奈 (ありよし じゅな [i]Ariyoshi Juna[/i])

The high-school heroine of [[earth_girl_arjuna|Earth Girl Arjuna]]. Her main distinguishing feature in both schoolgirl and TI form for most of the series is the Drop of Time, a bluish [[magatama]]-shaped jewel embedded in her forehead. Other features also include blue-black hair with prominent sidelocks and violet eyes (sometimes brown in color). Her TI form is taller, dressed in a distinctive pink [[bodysuit]], and has blonde 'hair' in a V-shape.

h4. See also

* [[chris_hawken|Chris Hawken]]

title: misumi_uika's_sister
body:
Character from [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!|BanG Dream! Ave Mujica]].

[i]Ave Mujica[/i] Episode 11 spoilers:

[spoilers]This tag is for the real [[Misumi Uika]].  The character tagged as [[Misumi Uika]] is actually Misumi Hatsune, Uika's half-sister, who has been impersonating Uika and living under her name for years. She looks the same as Hatsune, and was [[Togawa Sakiko]]'s original childhood friend.

Any posts referencing this character should generally be tagged with [[spoilers]].[/spoilers]

title: tav_(baldur's_gate)
body: The default name for the player character of [[Baldur's Gate 3]], should you choose the "Custom" and "[[the dark urge (baldur's gate)|Dark Urge]]" Origins. Tav's race, gender, appearance, and personality is entirely up to the player.

title: lich
body:
An [[undead]] [[wizard|sorcerer]] often with a [[skeleton|skeletal]] or [[corpse|cadaverous]] appearance. A staple of the sword-and-sorcery genre of [[fantasy]] fiction.

Unlike mindless [[zombie|zombies]], liches tend to be highly intelligent and are capable of using [[magic]]. They are frequently clad in armor or fine clothing reminiscent of wizards or kings.

h4.See also
* [[Dungeons & Dragons]]
* [[mummy]]
* [[vampire]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

title: plaid
body:
A pattern made up of many perpendicular vertical & horizontal lines of two or more colors. Compared to the uniformity of a [[checkered|check]] pattern, [[plaid]] features distinct irregularity in the width of its lines, and the colors used may not be "divided neatly":[https://imgur.com/a/k4DwICA] by said lines.

For plaid clothes, see [[plaid clothes]]. Otherwise, tag the specific object such as [[plaid umbrella]] or [[plaid curtains]].

h4. Example

* !post #6220850: Plaid background

h4. See also

* [[argyle]]
* [[checkered]]
* [[gingham]]
* [[grid]]
* [[houndstooth]]
* [[unmoving pattern]]
* "Wikipedia: Tartan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tartan]

title: sabrina_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Sabrina[/b], known as [b]Natsume[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [[pokemon rgby|Pokémon Red and Green]].

A powerful psychic herself, this Gym Leader who uses Psychic types can see the future with her precognitive powers. She allegedly does not like conflict. Her signature Pokémon is [[Alakazam]].

In her [[pokemon frlg|FRLG]] outfit, she has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She wears a [[bodysuit]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[red jacket|red]] [[turtleneck jacket|turtleneck]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] jacket, [[white gloves|gloves]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[side slit]] skirt, [[yellow thighhighs|yellow]] [[over-kneehighs]], and [[red boots]].

In her [[pokemon hgss|HGSS]] outfit, she has red eyes, [[long hair|long]] [[flipped hair]], a [[crop top|cropped]] [[pink camisole]] that exposes [[midriff]], large [[bracelet]]s, [[white pants]], and [[pink slippers]].

h4. Appearance

title: gorosei
body:
The [b]Gorosei[/b], or the [b]Five Elders[/b], are the group of five elite [[Celestial Dragons (one piece)|]] who co-ruled the World Government. As such, they served as the overarching main antagonists of the [[One Piece]] series.

Each member posses an extremely powerful Mythical [[Devil Fruit]] that allows them to transform into a gigantic monsters. In addition, they are practically immortal, as they are capable of regenerating even when their body were shattered to pieces.

[spoiler]In reality, they are serving under the secretive supreme ruler of the World Government [[Imu (one piece)|]], who granted them immortality. They acts as the "public" face of their authority.[/spoiler]

Only apply this tag if most, if not all members of the Gorosei were present within the image.

h4. Members
* [[Marcus Mars]]
* [[Topman Warcury]]
* [[Ethan-Baron V. Nusjuro]]
* [[Shepherd Ju Peter]]
* [[Jaygarcia Saturn]] [spoiler](killed, replaced by Garling)[/spoiler]
* [[Figarland Garling]]

title: s-snake
body:
[[One Piece]] character. A Seraphim (artificial Lunarian clone) of [[Boa Hancock]] and one of the seven "living weapons" created by [[Dr. Vegapunk]].

She appear as a child version of Hancock with Lunarian traits such as [[black wings]], [[dark skin]], and a fire emitting from her back. Albeit she is [[tall female|disproportionally tall]], even taller than her original. She is also often depicted in fanarts as a sort of palette swap version of Hancock in her hypothetical [[aged up|adult]] form.

title: boa_hancock
body:
[[One Piece]] character. She is the captain of the Kuja Pirates and the current empress of Amazon Lily. Also known as the "Snake Princess" and "Pirate Empress" due to her beauty, and one of the [[Shichibukai]].

She has two younger sisters, [[Boa Sandersonia|Sandersonia]] and [[Boa Marigold|Marigold]], and is often seen alongside her pet snake [[Salome (one piece)|]]. She would later on developed a crush on [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] during the Amazon Lily Arc.

Having consumed the Mero Mero no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], she can fire heart beams, bullets and arrows that turn anyone who is caught by her charm into stone.

[spoiler]Hancock along with her sisters were kidnapped and sold as slaves to a member of the [[Celestial Dragons (one piece)|]] during their childhood. Because of this, she suffered much abuse while enslaved and developed a hatred for males. Hancock's hatred later softened after she developed a crush on Luffy, who was the first man who acknowledged her suffering.[/spoiler]

h4. See also
* [[S-Snake]]

title: chicken_sandwich
body: A type of sandwich consist of a fried boneless Chicken Breasts or Thighs serve between two slices of bread or a burger bun. Sometimes referred to as a chicken burger internationally due to matching the form factor (even though the chicken meat isn't ground up and shaped into a patty).

title: pripyat
body: Prypiat (spelled as Pryp'yat') is an infamous [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] ghost town located in the [[Chernobyl|Chornobyl]] exclusion zone.

title: chernobyl
body:
An abandoned city in [[Ukraine]] infamous for a severe nuclear accident from the [[chernobyl npp|nearby power plant]] in 1986 that forced the area surrounding it to be abandoned.

This tag can also be applied when the town near Chornobyl, [[Pripyat]], is in the image.

title: erika_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Erika[/b] is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i].

A cute Gym Leader who loves Grass-type Pokémon, this well-mannered Trainer teaches flower arrangement in Kanto [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Vileplume]].

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[parted bangs]]. In her [[pokemon frlg|FRLG]] outfit, she wears a [[red hairband]], a [[yellow kimono|yellow]] [[poke ball print|print]] kimono with [[long sleeves|long]] and [[wide sleeves]], a [[red hakama|red]] [[hakama skirt]], [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[okobo]].

title: mahou_shoujo_ikusei_keikaku
body:
[b]Mahou Shoujo Ikusei Keikaku[/b] (魔法少女育成計画, lit. [i]Magical Girl Raising Project[/i], abbrev. [i]Mahoiku[/i]) is a magical girl action survival light novel series by Endou Asari. An anime adaptation by Lerche began airing Fall 2016 (Q4), covering the first arc "Unmarked."

When a picture only depicts a character's human form, please also tag their magical girl name as an umbrella tag for that character. When a picture only depicts a recurring protagonist, there is no need to tag the specific arc.

Please note that there are two identical mascots in the series: Fav and Fal. Fav only appeared in Unmarked, while Fal is a recurring character since Restart.

h4. Characters

title: chernobyl_npp
body: The nuclear power plant in the city of [[Chornobyl]], [[Ukraine]]. Usually depicted as it was after the installation of the "sarcophagus" following the reactor meltdown and explosion that occurred in 1986, sporting a red and white chimney and derelict appearance.
other_names: チェルノブイリ原子力発電所

title: arle_nadja
body: [[Madou Monogatari]] and [[Puyopuyo]] character, often accompanied by the yellow rabbit-like creature [[carbuncle (puyopuyo)|Carbuncle]]. By default, she has [[brown hair|brown]] or [[orange hair]] styled in a [[ponytail]]. Her official outfit typically includes a [[white shirt]], [[blue skirt]] and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]], with the exception of her [[school uniform]]. h4. Outfit changes * !asset #23079185: [[Puyopuyo]] * !asset #22950406: [[Puyopuyo~n]] * !asset #23079115: [[Puyopuyo Fever]] one and [[Puyopuyo Fever 2|two]] [1] * !asset #23079125: [[Puyopuyo 7]] * !asset #23079298: [[Puyopuyo 20th Anniversary]], et al [2] * [1] Arle's eyes are [[official alternate eye color|blue]] in the first Puyopuyo Fever only. * [2] Outfit also present in [[Puyopuyo Chronicle]], Puyopuyo Champions, [[Puyopuyo Tetris]] one and [[Puyopuyo Tetris 2|two]]. h4. [[Official Alternate costume]]s Puyopuyo 7 [[Mega Arle]] [[Mini Arle]] Puyopuyo Quest * [[arle_nadja_(gugugugu)|Gugugugu]] * [[arle_nadja_(winter_break)_(puyopuyo)|Winter break Arle]] h4. Trivia * In Madou Monogatari, she is a 6-year old girl who has to defeat monsters to graduate from kindergarten. In Puyopuyo, she is 16 years old. * She's currently voiced by [[Sonozaki Mie]] in Japanese and [[Erica Mendez]] in English. * She was voiced by [[Mitsuishi Kotono]] in [[PC Engine]] ports of the games. h4. See also * [[List of Puyopuyo characters]]

title: carbuncle_(puyopuyo)
body: [[Madou Monogatari]] and [[Puyopuyo]] character. The little yellow [[rabbit]]-like creature that is [[Arle Nadja]]'s best friend. Was voiced in Japanese for long time by [[Nakanishi Tamaki]] before her death in 2020, and had voiced by [[Mamiya Kurumi]] in Puyo Puyo~n as well. In English, he was voiced by [[Erin Fitzgerald]] in Puyo Puyo Tetris, then [[Julie Ann Taylor]] as of 2019.

title: abiotic_factor
body:
Abiotic Factor is a survival crafting experience for 1-6 players set in the depths of an underground research facility. Caught between paranormal containment failure, a military crusade, and chaos from a dozen realms, the world’s greatest minds must survive against the universe’s biggest threats.

title: photo-referenced
body:
An image that was inspired from a [[photo (medium)|]], or otherwise based on photographic source material, including video.

Artists will sometimes indicate that they are replicating a photograph (写真模写) or even outright tracing one (写真トレス) in their description or tags.

The referenced photo is sometimes displayed as a [[photo inset]].

h4. Examples

* !asset #20076336: [[Reference photo]]
* !post #7315357: [[Photo-referenced]]

h4. See also

title: yae_sakura
body:
A [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]/[[Benghuai Xueyuan]] character, [[Yae Rin]]'s older sister. Voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]] in Japanese.

title: love_live!_nijigasaki_high_school_idol_club
body:
The third entry in the [[Love Live!]] franchise. Originally announced as a spinoff of the [[Love Live! School Idol Festival]] mobile game under the working title [i]PERFECT Dream Project[/i], it was later revealed at Tokyo Game Show 2017 to be a brand new idol group who would be the main story focus of the upcoming [[Love Live! School Idol Festival All Stars]]. It follows the members of the Nijigasaki High School Idol Club, comprised of the three most popular N (Normal)-Rarity idols voted in from [i]School Idol Festival[/i], plus new characters introduced in [i]All Stars[/i]. 

Unlike the other Love Live! titles before it, this entry follows solo school idols, each performing with their own styles and preferences.

An anime adaptation was announced in December 2019 and aired from October to December 2020. Its second season was announced in May 2021 and aired from April to June 2022.

title: bubbly_voyage_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it gives [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] the ability to double jump and hover/float for a limited distance.

The outfit includes a [[short_dress|short]], [[layered_dress|layered]] [[blue_dress|blue dress]]. The dress is trimmed with white [[frills]] around the skirt and has a [[back_ribbon|ribbon trailing from the back]]. The dress and ribbon are [[striped_dress|both]] [[striped_ribbon|striped]] and the dress has a [[bubble_print|bubble pattern]]. Beneath the dress is a pair of blue and white [[bloomers]]. The outfit also has [[short_sleeves|short]] [[detached_sleeves|detached]] [[frilled sleeves]], [[ankle socks|short]] [[frilled socks]], [[black_footwear|black]] [[mary janes|mary jane]] [[high heels]], [[frilled wrist cuffs]], a [[frilled choker]] with a dark blue or black [[bow_choker| bow]], a [[white_hat]] with a [[blue bow]], and a small gold [[hair ornament]] shaped like a pair of bunny ears. The hairstyle for the outfit is [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde_hair]] tied up into two low-hanging [[hair rings]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a primarily green color scheme.

title: acheron_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Her name is taken from "the river located in Epirus, Greece":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acheron] which is said to be the branch of the underworld.

[spoilers]Her real name is revealed to be [b]Raiden Bosenmori Mei[/b].[/spoilers] Voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]] (JP) and [[Allegra Clark]] (EN). 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[hair intakes]] (and turn [[white hair|white]] upon using her ultimate), [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]], [[white jacket|white]] [[flame print]] [[cropped jacket]], [[black belt]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[asymmetrical legwear]] ([[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh boot]] on her right and a black [[knee boots|knee boot]] on her left), and [[black gloves]]. She uses a [[katana]] as her main weapon.

Upon using her ultimate, her arms [[colored extremities|turn red]] and her gloves are replaced by [[red flower]]s.

title: kalashnikov_rifle
body:
Any type of self-loading [[rifle]] based on Mikhail Kalashnikov's [[AK-47]] design. This includes license-manufactured variants outside of Russia as well. Please use this tag for any unidentified AK of unknown type. 

Please do not use for:

* Similar-looking rifles with different design (e.g. [[AN-94]], [[AS Val]], [[Dragunov SVD]] and [[Vz. 58]]).
* Rifles that copy the AK design but were not officially licensed (e.g. Finnish [[Rk62]], Israeli [[imi galil|Galil]] and [[Galil ACE]]).

title: senran_kagura_new_link
body:
[b]Shinobi Master: Senran Kagura NEW LINK[/b] ([b]シノビマスター 閃乱カグラ NEW LINK[/b]), officially abbreviated as  [b]ShinoMas[/b] ([b]シノマス[/b]), is a free-to-play collectible [[card_(medium)|card]] RPG for mobile devices. It was released to Android and iOS on November 29, 2017.

The game features each of the four schools from the [[senran kagura shinovi versus|Versus]] games, with more characters being added through periodic updates. Like [[Senran Kagura New Wave]], the gameplay centers around collecting cards, but in addition to the illustrations, each card unlocks a costume for use in [[3D]] turn-based combat.

It will end its live services on May 30, 2025, but an "offline" version will still be available after that date.

title: shaded_face
body:
When the upper face or eyes are shadowed without a tangible light source.

Often used to convey a wide variety of negative emotions, such as [[disgust]], [[angry|anger]], shock, or sinister intentions. Can be used for comedic effect.

If only one side of the face is shaded, use [[partially shaded face]].

Do not use this tag when the character's face is shadowed simply because of a light source - use [[shade]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #3961505

h4. See also

* [[faceless]]
* [[turn pale]]
* [[hair over eyes]]
* [[eyes in shadow]]
* [[partially shaded face]]
* [[gloom (expression)]]

title: hayato_kobayashi
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] series from 1979.

[b]Hayato Kobayashi[/b] is the young [[Japan]]ese pilot of the [[Guntank]] [[mobile suit]] during The One Year War. He also appears later in [[Zeta Gundam]] and [[Gundam ZZ]], where he is now a high ranking [[aeug|Karaba]] officer. 

[spoilers]After the events of the original Gundam, Hayato married [[Fraw Bow]] who became pregnant with his child, and adopted orphans [[Katz Kobayashi]], [[Letz Cofan]], and [[Kikka Kitamoto]].[/spoilers]
 
[spoilers]In Gundam ZZ Hayato dies during the First Neo Zeon War while piloting a [[Dodai Kai]] in [[battle]] against [[Rakan Dahkaran]] (who used a [[Zaku III]]) at the destroyed city of Dublin while defending refugees from a [[Colony Drop]] attack by [[Neo Zeon]].[/spoilers]

h4. See also
* [[Mobile Suit Guntank]]

title: galbaldy_beta
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RMS-117 Galbaldy β[/b]

An updated version of a leftover [[Zeon]] [[mobile suit]] project, the MS-17 [[Galbaldy Alpha]], which was in turn a redesign of the [[Gyan]] to account for the [[Gelgoog]]'s mid range characteristics and equipped with a [[beam rifle]]. 

The Galbaldys left behind were captured by the [[Earth Federation]], and gradually upgraded with the newer technologies such as the panoramic monitor and new thrusters. It was somewhat superior to the Gelgoog - but in the growing tensions leading up to the [[zeta_gundam|Gryps Conflict]], the Gelgoog wasn't even close to the standard anymore. 

It was used by the [[Titans (Gundam)]]. One unit was piloted by [[Lila Milla Rira]].
