title: reccoa_londe
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] universe.

She first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] series from 1985. 

[b]Reccoa Londe[/b] is an [[orange hair]]ed member of the [[AEUG]] intelligence division and [[Mobile Suit]] [[pilot]], her [[mecha]] of choice is the [[Methuss]]. 

[spoiler]Reccoa met and became friends with [[Kai Shiden]] during a mission infiltrating the Titans' base at Jaburo on planet Earth. Later during another infiltration mission on the Titans ship [i]The Jupitris[/i], Reccoa met [[Paptimus Scirocco]], who used his Newtype powers and charm to discover her disguise and affiliation and eventually turn her to the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] side. Reccoa was given the [[Palace Athene]] MS by Scirocco and she killed [[Bask Om]] after destroying his ship with it (on Paptimus orders).[/spoiler] 

[spoiler]Reccoa Londe died fighting against [[Emma Sheen]]'s [[Gundam Mk II]] at the final battle of The Gryps War.[/spoiler]

body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]].

[b]Buran Blutarch[/b] is a veteran Earth division [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] officer and MS pilot. His [[mobile suit]] of choice is the [[Asshimar]]. He has [[blonde hair]], [[huge eyebrows]] and a high [[pompadour]], as well as [[long sideburns]].

[spoiler]Dies during the [i]Battle of Kennedy Spaceport[/i], killed when his MS was impaled by a beam saber used by a red [[Rick Dias]] piloted by [[Amuro Ray]].[/spoiler]

title: quattro_bajeena
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] series, [b]Quattro Bajeena[/b] is a male character and supporting protagonist in Mobile Suit [[Zeta Gundam]]. An [[AEUG]] veteran [[mobile_suit|MS]] [[pilot]], Captain Quattro pilots a red [[Rick Dias]], the [[Gundam Mk II]] and the [[Hyaku Shiki]]. He also pilots the [[zero_shiki_(gundam)|Zero Shiki]] and the [[Delta Gundam]] as simulator data.

The official [[Bandai]] romanization of his name is "Quattro Bajeena", and also (humorously) "Quattro Vagina" in several PS1 Gundam games, such as SD Gundam G-Generation F and Char's Counterattack.

In an infamous letter in [[Engrish text|Engrish]] to [[Hayato Kobayashi]] (post #14851), [[Kai Shiden]] writes:

[spoiler][i]"Captain Quattro, he is a CHAR"[/i]: Quattro Bajeena is the pseudonym [[Char Aznable]] uses throughout [[Zeta Gundam]].[/spoilers] 

[spoilers]Quattro/Char's Hyaku Shiki MS was severely damaged in battle during his final duel with [[Haman Karn]] (in her [[Qubeley]]). Apparently destroyed after Haman defeats Quattro, its wreckage is later shown floating in space with its [[cockpit]] hatch open, implying Quattro/Char's survival of the encounter.[/spoilers]

title: seabook_arno
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]Seabook Arno[/b] is the main protagonist of [[Gundam F91]], and childhood friend of [[Cecily Fairchild]]. During an incursion of his native colony by the vile [[Crossbone Vanguard]], he takes up arms in the cutting-edge [[F91 Gundam]] to fend off the insurgent pirates. 

[spoiler]After the Cosmo Babylonia Uprising, Seabook chooses to join forces with Cecily, now using her birth name of Berah Ronah, and lead a reformed Crossbone Vanguard under the alias of [[Kincade Nau]], at the controls of the [[Crossbone Gundam X-1]].[/spoiler]

title: paper_doll_chain
body:
A paper doll chain is a papercraft where paper is folded accordion-style and while folded it is cut into a typically simple person shape.  When it is unfolded multiple copies of the person shape will be left interconnected in a long "chain."

title: nintendo_switch
body:
[[Nintendo|Nintendo's]] seventh game console, released in the Eighth Generation of consoles and the successor to the [[Wii U]]. Known as the NX during development. The first production model went on sale on March 3rd, 2017. 

The Nintendo Switch has two dedicated [[game controller]]s (one for each hand) called [[Joy-Con]]s. These can be attached to and removed from the console at will, essentially making it a hybrid home/handheld platform.

A smaller version, the [[nintendo switch lite|Switch Lite]], was revealed July 10th, 2019, built strictly for handheld gaming. The Lite has no detachable Joy-Cons; the controllers are hard-built into the console. It also has no HDMI output so cannot be connected to a TV like the original model Switch can. A [[nintendo switch - oled model|higher-end version]] featuring an OLED screen was released on October 8, 2021. 

The platform has enjoyed a positive reception and high sales numbers in the years since its release. In addition to carrying many popular flagship titles like [[The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild]] and [[Super Mario Odyssey]], the Switch has also become a welcoming home for many older games from last-gen systems. This led the Switch to be the [i]de facto[/i] portable way to play popular older titles like [[Diablo 3]], [[Dark Souls I]] and [[Castle Crashers]] which had previously only been playable on non-portable platforms. As of early 2023, the combined Switch product line is one of the best-selling platforms in Nintendo's entire history, outselling both the [[Wii]] and the [[Game Boy]] and now second only to the [[Nintendo DS]].

For tagging purposes, if the Switch has its Joy-Cons detached (or is being controlled by other compatible controllers), tag it as a [[game console]] (post #3259420, post #3528468). If the Switch has at least one Joy-Con connected or the console itself is the Lite, tag it as a [[handheld game console]] (post #3471232, post #3470179).

h4. See also

* [[Nintendo Switch 2]]
* [[Nintendo Switch Pro Controller]]
* [[Nintendo Switch Lite]]
* [[Nintendo Switch - OLED Model]]
* [[Ring-Con]]
* [[List of game consoles]]
other_names: ニンテンドースイッチ

title: nintendo_2ds
body: A [[Nintendo 3DS]] model without the 3D functionality. It is also not a clamshell, unlike the rest of the 3DS lineup.

title: nintendo_3ds
body:
A [[handheld game console]] released by [[Nintendo]] in February 2011. Successor to the [[Nintendo DS]].

New features include an autostereoscopic 3D upper screen, 360 degree analog slide pad, 3D-capable camera, telescopic stylus among other upgrades.

Not to be confused with the [[Nintendo DSi]]. The 3DS has a front camera, a circle pad above the D-pad, and its upper screen is wider than its lower screen.

* [[Nintendo 2DS]]

* "Wikipedia: Nintendo 3DS":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nintendo_3DS]

Komugi gains the ability to become a human, and borrows her owner's surname. She transforms into [[Cure Wonderful]], and is [[Cure Friendy]]'s partner. She is voiced by [[Naganawa Maria]].

title: no_feet
body:
Applies to characters with legs but lacking normal feet, whose legs usually end in a point or something similar. Note that this does not refer to images of characters who have had their legs amputated, nor to images of characters whose feet are not in the frame, but rather to characters who naturally do not have feet.

h4. See Also
* [[mechanical legs]]
* [[feet out of frame]]
* [[cropped legs]]

title: song_of_the_south
body:
Controversial 1946 [[Disney]] animated and live-action movie about a young boy Johnny and his friendship with the [[Uncle Remus]]. As the movie is set a plantation in the Reconstruction era after the [[American Civil War]], the film featured a large number of [[racism|racist]] black stereotypes, which led to the movie being a subject of polarizing debate and was withheld from re-release by Disney ever since.

Aside from racial stereotype issue, it is more positively well known for it's animated segments featuring talking animals which are still used in [[Disneyland]] and related merch.

title: pin
body:
Sharp, slender objects used to fasten things together. Unlike sewing [[needle|needles]], which have a hole used for drawing thread, pins have a head like a [[nail (hardware)|]], but smaller, round, and usually made from plastic. They are commonly used to secure fabrics for [[sewing]] or stick papers and photos to [[bulletin_board|bulletin boards]].

Use a more specific tag if one exists:

h4.Accessories often called "pins"
* [[badge]]
** [[button badge]]
* [[brooch]]
* [[lapel pin]]

h4.See also
* [[acupuncture]]
* [[clothes pin]]
* [[grenade pin]]
* [[hairpin]]
* [[insect pin]]
* [[pushpin]]
* [[safety pin]]
* [[sewing pin]]
** [[pincushion]]
* [[thumbtack]]
* [[voodoo doll]]

title: paresthesia
body:
An abnormal sensation of the skin (tingling, pricking, chilling, burning, numbness) with no apparent physical cause. It happens when sustained pressure is placed on a nerve (from [[seiza|sitting with legs crossed for too long]], or [[arm_pillow|fallen asleep with an arm crooked under their head]]...) . The feeling quickly goes away once the pressure is relieved.

Also known in English as "[body part] falling asleep" or "[[pin]]s and [[needle]]s".

title: sakura_miko_(street)
body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Sakura Miko]]. Unlike her past [[Amagai Tarou]] designs, this costume was designed by [[Saekiyahiro]].

It consists of a [[straw hat]], a [[detached collar|detached]] [[wing collar]] with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress|white]] [[pleated dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[vertical-striped skirt|vertical-striped]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[miniskirt]] over it, [[white socks]] and [[black boots|black]] [[lace-up boots]]. She also has optional [[frilled gloves]] [[white gloves|white]] short [[bridal gauntlets]] and several combinations of accessories, including a [[black shrug|black]] [[frilled shrug]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[overskirt]] and a [[black dress|]] [[strapless dress]] layer, as well as a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] version of the base dress.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her [[medium hair|medium-length hair]] tied into a [[french braid]] [[half updo]] with a small [[one side up]] on her left tied with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]] and a small [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]] with [[cherry blossoms]] on the back of her head.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21340653: Profile
* !post #7301925: Reference sheet
* !post #7295122: Merchandise

title: sakura_miko_(school_uniform)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Sakura Miko]], released in March 2023. 

It is [[school uniform]] themed, consisting of a [[white hat|white]] [[beret]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[pink jacket|pink]] [[Letterman jacket]] with [[white sleeves|white]] [[raglan sleeves]], a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]] and a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[pink skirt|pink]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], a red [[thigh strap]] on her left leg styled as a torii, [[white thighhighs]], and [[pink shoes|pink]] [[platform footwear|platform]] [[sneakers]]. She also has an optional [[red bag|red]] [[randoseru]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[short hair|short]]-[[medium hair]] decorated with a [[cat hair ornament|cat-shaped]] [[hairclip]] on one side and 2 regular hairclips on the other. 

h4. Appearance

title: sakura_miko_(new_year)
body:
The 5th/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Sakura Miko]].

It's a [[sweet lolita]]/[[wa lolita]] costume consisting of a [[detached collar]]  with a [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[neck ribbon]] and [[pom pom (clothes)|pom poms]], a [[frilled kimono|frilled]] [[sleeveless kimono]], [[frilled sleeves|frilled]] [[white sleeves|white]]/[[pink sleeves|light pink]] [[detached sleeves]] a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[pleated skirt|pink]] [[underbust]] [[high waist skirt]] with several [[white skirt|white]] [[layered skirt|layers]] and a [[petticoat]] underneath, a [[taiyaki]]-[[food-themed bag|shaped]] [[handbag]] [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]] [[bobby socks]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[geta]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her [[long hair]] decorated with a [[frilled hairband|frilled]] [[white hairband|white]] [[lolita hairband]] with [[pom pom hair ornament]]s and [[hairclip]]s, tied into [[french braid]]s that turn into [[twintails]] with [[hair rings]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25351540: Profile
* !post #6050981: Reference sheet
* !post #7090131: Merchandise

title: sakura_miko_(casual)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Sakura Miko]], released in March 2021.

Her casual attire consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[cat hat|cat]] [[beret]], a beige/[[yellow cardigan|light yellow cardigan]], an optional [[red scarf]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with [[frilled sleeves]] and [[shoulder cutout]]s, a small [[red bowtie]] with a cat-shaped [[neck bell|neck]] [[jingle bell]], an [[underbust]] [[bodice]] with a [[red sash]], [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]] [[miniskirt]], [[black thighhighs]] held up with [[garter straps]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]]. She has [[red-framed eyewear|red-framed]] [[under-rim eyewear|bottom-rim glasses]] as an optional accesory.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her [[long hair]] tied into [[low twintails]] with an [[ahoge]] and [[double-parted bangs]] decorated with a cherry blossom-shaped [[hairclip]] and small bows with [[cat hair ornament|cat ornaments]] on her twintails.

title: azki_(hololive)
body:
A [[hololive]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Debuted in November 2018 and joined [i]Inonaka Music[/i] alongside [[Hoshimachi Suisei]] in May 2019, before transferring to hololive proper in April 2022 following the dissolution of the label. Current design by [[Scottie (phantom2)|]].

Her name is stylized "AZKi", with only the 'i' in lower case (a convention later repeated with [[hololive English]]'s [[IRyS (hololive)|]], who also debuted as a virtual singer before converting to a regular VTuber.)

She has [[black hair]] (although her recent models have more of a [[brown hair|dark brown]] tone) with the length depending on her outfit with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Prior to her transfer to hololive, she had distinctive pink [[facial mark]]s under her eyes, which were later removed with her transfer and the fourth redesign, and instead replaced by a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]].

Her default hairstyle in her current form is [[very long hair]] with [[hair intakes]], [[double-parted bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[half updo]] tied into a [[half up half down braid]] that turns into a [[short ponytail]], decorated with a [[hairclip]], she also has [[pink hair|pink]] and [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] in addition to the [[colored inner hair]] from her previous model.

h4. Costumes

title: azki_(new_year)_(hololive)
body:
The 6th/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[AZKi (hololive)|]]. This is her second costume that does not involve a change in her overall appearance as is normally associated with AZKi's first four costumes, instead keeping the appearance from her [[AZKi (4th costume) (hololive)|fourth iteration]]. The design for the costume was first revealed on December 2023 but didn't get a full model until her 6th anniversary in November 2024.

It consists of a [[beret]] with [[pink hat|pink]] to [[white hat|white]] [[gradient hat|gradient]], a [[white scarf|white]] [[fur scarf]], a [[pink kimono|pink]] [[floral print kimono]] top with [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[furisode sleeves]], a [[long skirt|long]] [[blue skirt|blue]] [[hakama skirt]] with a [[floral print]] on the front that transitions into a [[starry sky print]] on the back and [[brown boots|brown]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[knee boots]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] is the same [[medium hair]] in a [[bob cut]] from her 4th costume, decorated with a [[hair flower|flower]] [[kanzashi]] when not wearing the beret.

It consists of a [[black choker]], a [[black jacket|black]] [[hooded jacket]] with a [[wolf hood]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[cross-laced sleeves]] decorated with [[tassel]]s [[jingle bell]]s, than she usually wears [[open jacket|open]]/[[unzipped]] but has the ability to fully close, a [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[sailor shirt]] with a visible [[crop top overhang|overhang]] a [[white sailor collar]], a [[two-tone neckerchief]] [[white neckerchief|white]] and [[red neckerchief]], and a [[floral print|floral]] [[print shirt|print]] [[floral print shirt|section]] on her left side, [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts|short]] [[side slit shorts]] with a [[cross-laced slit]], a [[thigh strap]] on her left thigh and a [[calflet]] on her right leg, [[white socks|white]] [[loose socks]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]] with red [[colored shoe soles]].

title: mazda_furai
body: The Mazda Furai was a concept car revealed on 27 December 2007. It had Mazda's flagship rotary engine design and chassis based on real Le-Mans car. The car wore the number 55, that of its 1991 24 Hours of Le Mans-winning ancestor, the [[Mazda 787B|787B]]. While the [[Top Gear]] test driver Mark Ticehurst was piloting the Furai on August 19, 2008, it suddenly caught fire, ultimately burning down almost completely, while the pilot escaped fire unscathed. Mazda then abandoned the project, and no news followed.

title: super_robot_wars
body:
(スーパーロボットたいせんシリーズ, Super Robot Taisen Series, "Super Robot Wars Series"), abbreviated as "SupaRobo" or "SRW". 

A long-running, cross-platform strategic RPG video game series by Banpresto. Its premise is that it combines the characters, stories and (most importantly) mecha of various [[super robot]] and [[mecha]] science fiction anime series. 

This tag refers in particular to original characters created by Banpresto for the games (as well as other elements exclusive to them).

title: minecraft_youtube
body:
A term generally used to refer to specific Western [[Minecraft]] video content on platforms such as YouTube and Twitch, especially those surrounding survival multiplayer servers (SMPs) and the communities that develop from them. Some creators stream themselves acting out elaborate LARPs in SMPs, which inspire artists to draw fanart of the characters they play. Both art of the streamers and art of the Minecraft servers they stream go here.

The term is applied more on a cultural level than on a literal level - YouTubers that play Minecraft once often aren't considered to fall into this category as they do not have wider connections to the scene as a whole, which is largely collaborative and overlaps often.

Please note that the [[real life]] copytag should only be used for posts actually depicting content creators in real life and not their personas or in-game characters. Additionally, [[Minecraft]] should not be tagged unless elements from the game are present (such as scenery, locations, items, species, etc).

h4. Copyrights

* [[Afterlife SMP]]
* [[Dream SMP]]
* [[Empires SMP]]
* [[Evolution SMP]]
* [[Free Trial SMP]]
* [[Hermitcraft]]
* [[Karmaland]]
* [[Lifesteal SMP]]
* [[MC Championship]]
* [[Mianite (series)|]]
* [[Minecraft Manhunt]]
* [[New Life SMP]]

title: sleepy
body:
Feeling the need to [[sleeping|sleep]], either at the end of the [[day]] or when [[waking up]] in the [[morning]].

Common signs of sleepiness include [[one eye closed]] or [[half-closed eyes]], [[yawning]], [[stretching|stretching]], [[rubbing eyes]], [[bags under eyes]], and [[squeans|sleep bubbles]] around the head.

See [[exhausted]] for when someone is tired due to [[exercising]] or strenuous physical activity.

h4. See also

* [[sleeping]]
* [[waking another]]
* [[waking up]]
* [[squeans]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

title: ivorycello
body:
[[Minecraft YouTube]]r and creator of the series [[Whitepine]]. She originally became known under the username Mythrodak for her prison escape videos, but in 2022, she decided to abandon the name after coming out as a transgender woman.

Her persona is a young woman with white skin and hair, horns, and a scar on one side of her face, often shown with roses. In the context of [[Whitepine]], she wears a [[maid]] uniform.

h4. External links

* "Wikitubia: Ivory":https://youtube.fandom.com/wiki/Ivory
* "Whitepine Wiki: Ivory":https://whitepine-minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Ivory

title: whitepine
body:
[[Minecraft YouTube]] horror/period drama series created by [[Ivorycello]], featuring a cinematic style. 

Follows the shy Ivory as she begins working as a [[maid]] for the rich Hemlocke family, only to be thrust into the middle of a murder mystery.

h4. External links

* "Whitepine Wiki: Whitepine":https://whitepine-minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Whitepine

title: parkour_civilization
body:
Two [[minecraft youtube|Minecraft]] "movies" by [[Evbo]] that take place in a world where players must parkour to be fed and increase their social status from "parkour noob" to "parkour pro". The world is largely made up of single grass blocks in the sky with gaps between them.

Suddenly went viral on Twitter in October 2024.

title: total_drama
body:
[b]Total Drama[/b] is a Canadian animated television series. The series is both a homage and satire of common conventions from reality television competition shows. 

The original series consists of 5 seasons; "Total Drama Island", "Total Drama Action", "Total Drama World Tour", "Total Drama: Revenge of the Island", and "Total Drama All-Stars and Pahkitew Island"; and two spinoffs in "Total Drama Presents: The Ridonculous Race" and "Total DramaRama". The series would be rebooted with a new season of "Total Drama Island". 

h4. Characters
* [[Chris McLean]] - Host

* [[Beth (total drama)|]]
* [[Cody (total drama)|]]
* [[Courtney (total drama)|]]
* [[Crimson (total drama)|]]
* [[Gwen (total drama)|]]
* [[Heather (total drama)|]]
* [[Izzy (total drama)|]]
* [[LeShawna (total drama)|]]
* [[Lindsay (total drama)|]]

title: color_contrast
body:
An image with strongly contrasting or opposing colors, most commonly taking the form of [[warm_colored|warm]]-[[cool_colored|cool]] contrast.

Opposing colors contrast with each other more than any other color pair, making both colors appear brighter, or to bring focus to a certain part of the image.

h4. Examples

* !post #6811070: Blue and yellow
* !post #7599739: Blue and red
* !post #6972477: Green and red
* !post #7564656:  Green and pink

h4. See also

* [[Analogous colors]]
* [[High contrast]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Complementary colors":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Complementary_colors

title: incineroar
body:
[[Pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0727 in the National Pokédex, a Fire/Dark-type starter. 

A bipedal, [[tiger]] Pokémon with a [[muscular]] build. Has a short snout with a small red nose, bright [[green eyes]] with [[yellow_sclera|yellow sclerae]], and tiny, pointed ears. Large tufts of [[red fur]] extend from its cheeks, and much of its face is also red.

Evolves from [[Torracat]] (from [[Litten]]).

Playable in [i][[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]][/i].

Japanese name: [b]Gaogaen[/b]

title: greninja
body:
[[Pokemon]] #658 in the National PokéDex, a dual-type Water/Dark Pokémon. 

It evolves from [[Frogadier]] starting at level 36. It is the final form of [[Froakie]]. 

Greninja is a large, bipedal, frog-like Pokémon. Its body and legs are dark blue, with single large white bubbles on its legs and arms and white spots over its eyes. On the sides of each of its upper thighs is a light blue, four-pointed star, which resembles a shuriken. Its back feet have two toes, while its front feet have three toes. Its feet are webbed, and it has a yellow chest and a yellow-and-blue face. It has eyes with white sclera, red irises, and white pupils. A large, projecting dark blue stripe runs down the middle of its head, with projecting light blue stripes in between its large, yellow ears. Its mouth is hidden behind a large, pink tongue that wraps around Greninja's neck and extends outward behind its head. 

It has one alternate form: [[Ash-Greninja]].

Japanese Name: [b]Gekkouga[/b]

Playable in [i][[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. U]][/i].

Prior Pokémon: [[Frogadier]]
Next Pokémon: [[Bunnelby]]

title: black_skin
body:
Skin colored [[black]], like coal or ebony. The opposite of [[white skin]].

For the usual brown, use [[dark skin]], [[very dark skin]] and/or [[tan]] as appropriate.

Unlike [[very dark skin]], black skin has no undertone, no hint of brown, yellow or red. Even the darkest of natural human skin has an undertone, even if not easily percieved at first glance or in some pictures. 

* !post #7639221: The character on the left has [[black skin]], while the character in the middle has [[dark skin]]
h4. See also

title: commentary
body:
A post where the artist commentary is understandable by the average English speaker. This can be because it was translated by a Danbooru user into English from another language, the original commentary was already in [[English commentary|English]], or the commentary consists of [[symbol-only commentary|symbols]] or something similar.

Do not use this tag with [[mixed-language commentary]] unless [i]all[/i] non-English languages present have been translated. Exception for [[bilingual commentary]] and [[multilingual commentary]] where one of the languages is English and all non-English is correctly translated by the artist.

For [i]untranslated[/i] artist commentary, use [[commentary request]] instead, plus the corresponding "[language]_commentary":/wiki_pages?search%5Btitle_normalize%5D=*_commentary&redirect=true tag if not Japanese.

If the only untranslated portions of a commentary are meta, such as hashtags or mentions, then tag it with [[commentary]] and not [[partial commentary]] or [[commentary request]].

h4. Related tags

h6. Languages

"Japanese commentary" is not a tag on Danbooru because it is treated as the default language. Other languages are tagged:

* [[Arabic commentary]]
* [[Chinese commentary]]
* [[Danish commentary]]
* [[English commentary]] (No translation required)
** [[Engrish commentary]] (May or may not require "translation")

title: hell
body:
In religion and folklore, hell is a place of eternal suffering and torment, meant to punish evil souls in the afterlife. It is the place where [[demon]]s and other vile creatures reside.

It is commonly depicted as a hot, desolated [[wasteland]] with an abundance of [[fire]] and [[lava]]. The opposite of hell is [[heaven]].

title: heaven
body:
In religion and folklore, heaven is a higher realm where gods and [[angel]]s, as well as those who committed good deeds reside after their death.

In popular culture, heaven is often modelled after the Christian depiction of heaven as a place further up in the [[sky]] with an abundance of [[cloud]]s. The opposite of heaven is [[hell]].

h4.See also

* [[heaven (kanji)]]

title: zeta_plus_a1_(amuro_colors)
body:
A fictional variable geometry giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]MSZ-006A1 Zeta Plus A1 (Amuro Colors)[/b]

A special [[Zeta Plus]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] unit intended as a technology demonstrator. It was painted in an attractive red and beige color scheme, unlike the dull gray of most Zeta Plus units, and bore the insignia of its pilot, the legendary [[AEUG]] Newtype [[Amuro Ray]], on its left shoulder.

      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]170 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]1 year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A messenger employee of [[penguin_logistics_(arknights)|Penguin Logistics]] who always acts alone. Nothing is known about her previous work history before joining Penguin Logistics. She was sent to Rhodes Island as a liaison for Penguin Logistics, where she assists with a variety of operations. She uses two staves as her choice of weapons, named "Black Lock" and "White Key" which she uses to slow the nervous system of her enemies, making it feel like she's stopping time.

[spoilers]Her motif is based on fallen angels, which is related to a tragic incident in her past. Her callsign itself is a reference to Mastema, who was a fallen angel in Judaism.[/spoilers]

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Mizuki Nana]].

body:
[i]Muelsyse, Rhine Lab Collaborating Operator. A strange, peculiar ecologist.[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

  [/tbody]

[/expand]

Director of the Ecology Section of [[Rhine Lab (arknights)|]] and third person ever to join the company after [[Kristen (arknights)|]] and [[Saria (arknights)|]], whom she deeply treasures as dear friends.

She likes fashion, photography, literature, music, gaming and dancing.

Thanks to her elven characterstics, she is able to transform and clone herself into water, but is highly susceptible to Originium. She dreams of building a safe place for her kin, so as to not to feel alone being the only Elf living in modern society.

[spoiler]During the Rhine lab trilogy, she assumes both an antagonistic and supportive role, as she's torn in the rift between Saria and Kristen. She bonds with the [[Doctor (arknights)|]] over their shared feeling of loneliness.[/spoiler]

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Tamura Yukari]] (Japanese), Wang Yaxin (Chinese), Kayli Mills (English), and Park Si-yoon (Korean). Her art designer is [[NoriZC]].

title: roberto_(gundam)
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]Roberto[/b] is a veteran [[AEUG]] mobile suit pilot with a [[mustache]] and one of [[Quattro Bajeena]]'s loyal wingmen. His [[mobile_Suit|MS]] of choice is the [[Rick Dias]], initially painted black and grey, then red.

[spoilers]Roberto used to be a [[Zeon]] MS pilot (Real name: Ricardo Vega) during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. He dies while participating in a ground battle while protecting an AEUG [[space shuttle]], killed when his Rick Dias was destroyed by a [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[Asshimar]] piloted by [[Buran Blutarch]] during the [i]Battle of Kennedy Spaceport[/i].[/spoilers]

title: marvel_zombies
body: Marvel Zombies is a five-issue limited series published from December 2005 to April 2006 by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. The series was written by Robert Kirkman with art by Sean Phillips and covers by Arthur Suydam. It was the first series in the Marvel Zombies series of related stories. The story is set in an alternate universe where the world's superhero population has been infected with a virus that turned them into zombies. The series was spun out of events of the crossover story-arc of Ultimate [[Fantastic Four]], where the zombie [[Reed Richards]] tricked his Ultimate counterpart into opening a portal to the zombie universe only for the latter to contain the former from ever coming to his universe.

title: asshimar
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]NRX-044 Asshimar[/b]

One of the first transformable mass-production [[mobile suit]]s developed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Earth Federation Titans]]. It had a tri-star shaped monoeye visor reminiscent of the [[Dom (mobile suit)|]], and its green and light orange paint scheme makes it resemble a [[pumpkin]] or a ham[[burger]] in MA mode. The Asshimar is armed with a potent high capacity [[beam rifle]].

One of the first units was piloted by Titans officer [[Buran Blutarch]].

After the fall of the Titans, the unit was studied and refined into the more modern [[Anksha]] used by the [[Earth Federation]].

title: solg
body:
An orbital weapons platform featured in [i][[ace_combat_05|Ace Combat 5: The Unsung War]][/i]. The full name is the [b]Strategic Orbital Linear Gun[/b]. Originally planned by the Osean Federation to act as a deterrence to Yuktobania, development was refocused to be used against Belka during the Belkan War. After Belka surrendered however, development for the weapon ceased.

[spoilers]During the events of Ace Combat 5, the Grey Men; a group of hard-line Belkan nationalists who orchestrated the war between the Osean Federation and Yuktobania, later completed the SOLG and equipped it with a V2 warhead during the Circum-Pacific War. It is featured in the final mission of the game, where Razgriz Squadron must destroy the core components of the satellite before it crashes into the Osean capital of Oured. [/spoilers]

title: esrb
body:
The [b]Entertainment Software Rating Board[/b] (ESRB) is an American organization that assigns age and content ratings to video games. It was formed in 1994 in response to criticism of games featuring violent or sexual content.

This tag refers to the [[content rating]] logos themselves. The ratings are as follows:

* [b]EC[/b]: Early Childhood. For games aimed towards younger children.
* [b]E[/b]: Everyone. For games suitable for all ages. Formerly Kids to Adults (K-A) until 1998.
* [b]E10+[/b]: Everyone 10+. For games suitable for those aged 10 or older.
* [b]T[/b]: Teen. For games suitable for those aged 13 or older.
* [b]M[/b]: Mature. For games suitable for those aged 17 or older.
* [b]AO[/b]: Adults Only. For games suitable for those aged 18 or older. A very rare rating, it is mostly applied to adult video games and is not allowed to be sold in stores or on consoles.

h4. See also
* [[CERO]] (Computer Entertainment Rating Organization) for the Japanese rating system.
* [[PEGI]] (Pan-European Game Information) for the European rating system.

h4. External links

* "Official site":[https://www.esrb.org/]
* "Wikipedia: Entertainment_Software_Rating_Board":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entertainment_Software_Rating_Board]

title: oogami_sachi
body:
A character from [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]. Former student council president of Hasu no Sora Girls' High School from the 101st graduating class. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[green hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[yellow eyes|yellow-ish]] [[brown eyes]]. She also wears two [[hairclip|hairclips]].

She wears an [[armband]] fastened with a [[safety pin]] showing her status as the student council president.

[spoilers]She used to be the only member of the School Idol Club from the 101st class, being part of [i][[cerise bouquet|all]] [[dollchestra|three]] [[mira-cra park!|units]][/i] in the 102nd term due to being the only senior in the club at the time. She stopped being a school idol due to conflicts with her student council work.[/spoilers] 

She has since graduated from Hasu no Sora in March 2024.

Voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]].

title: distortion_(project_moon)
body:
Distortion is a recurring phenomena in [[Project Moon]] media, first introduced in [[Library Of Ruina]] before being expanded upon in [[The Distortion Detective]] and [[Limbus Company]].

Distortion is primarily caused when an individual communicates with the Voice ([spoiler][[Carmen (project moon)|]][/spoiler]) and accepts their offer rather than reject them, or by being in proximity of a Monolith.

Distortion causes an individual to change into a distorted/monstrous version of themselves, which is usually permanent (and can eventually result in the individual transforming into an Abnormality), but can be reversed. One may even manifest [[E.G.O (project moon)|]] after distorting, or vice versa.
If a person fails to either distort or manifest E.G.O, they may turn into a Peccatulum.

h1. Notable Distortions:
* [[The Pianist_(project_moon)|]]  
* [[Papa Bongy_(project_moon)|]]
* [[The Crying Children_(project_moon)|]]

title: suou_patra
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Debuted as part of [[Nanashi Inc.]]'s [[Honey Strap]] with occasional assistance from [[Project Upd8]], then just Nanashi Inc. when the company integrated its sub-groups on March 21st 2023, before leaving to become an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] on May 9, 2023 by purchasing the rights associated with her character. Her pet/viewer insert is [[Kanikama (suou patra)|]].

She has [[grey hair|grey]] and [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient hair]] in all of her costumes, although the length varies. She is a [[demon girl]] with a spade-shaped [[demon tail|tail]], but her spiky [[red horns|red]] [[demon horns|horns]] also change in size. Her eyes are almost always [[orange eyes|orange]] and she has [[large breasts]] and [[pointy ears]].

title: kastus_kalinouski_regiment
body:
The [b]Kastus Kalinouski Regiment[/b] is a Belarusian volunteer military unit fighting under Ukrainian command in the [[Russo-Ukrainian War]]. Originally formed in 2022 as the Kastus Kalinouski Battalion, it was later expanded into a regiment due to an influx of volunteers. Named after [[Kastus Kalinouski]], a 19th-century Belarusian revolutionary, the unit consists of Belarusians opposing the pro-Russian regime of [[Alexander Lukashenko]] and supporting Ukraine against Russian aggression.

The regiment operates as part of [[Ukrainian_Ground_Forces|Ukraine’s Armed Forces]] and has participated in multiple engagements against Russian forces. While it is primarily a military unit, it also represents a broader anti-Lukashenko resistance movement, advocating for a democratic Belarus free from Russian influence.

Since its formation, the Kastus Kalinouski Regiment has been a target of Russian and Belarusian state propaganda, which portrays it as a terrorist organization and an instrument of Western influence. Despite this, the regiment remains a key symbol of Belarusian opposition to authoritarian rule and continues to attract volunteers.

h4. Insignia

* !asset #25342817: Current Insignia

h4. See also

* [[Paulinka_(japanon)|]]
* [[Kupalinka]]
* [[Emilia Plyaterska]]
* [[Russo-Ukrainian war]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Kastus Kalinouski Regiment":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kastu%C5%9B_Kalino%C5%ADski_Regiment]

title: international_legion_of_ukraine
body:
The [b]International Legion of Ukraine[/b] is a foreign volunteer military unit operating under the [[Ukrainian_ground_forces|Armed Forces of Ukraine]]. Established in February 2022, it was created in response to Ukraine's call for foreign fighters to help defend the country against [[russo-ukrainian_war|Russia’s full-scale invasion]]. The unit consists of volunteers from multiple nations, including the United States, the United Kingdom, Canada, Poland, Georgia, and others.

The legion is structured similarly to Ukraine’s military and is divided into battalions based on nationality and language. It has been involved in frontline combat, reconnaissance, and special operations across various battle zones, including Kyiv, Kharkiv, and Donetsk.

Since its formation, the unit has been a subject of Russian disinformation, with Kremlin sources branding its members as "mercenaries" and threatening them with execution if captured. Despite these claims, the Ukrainian government recognises the legion as an official part of its armed forces, ensuring that its members are treated as lawful combatants under the Geneva Conventions.

h4. Insignia

* !asset #25342735: Current Insignia

h4. See also

* [[Kenneth Del Duca]]
* [[Russo-Ukrainian war]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: International Legion of Ukraine":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Legion_(Ukraine)]

title: kraken_regiment
body:
The [b]Kraken Regiment[/b] is a Ukrainian special forces unit operating under the [[directorate_of_intelligence_(ukraine)|Defence Intelligence of Ukraine]] (GUR). Formed in February 2022 at the onset of the [[Russo-Ukrainian war|Russian full-scale invasion of Ukraine]], it was established by veterans of the [[azov_battalion|Azov Regiment]] and other military volunteers. Unlike Azov, it is not part of the [[national_guard_of_ukraine|National Guard]] but operates under Ukraine’s military intelligence, giving it a degree of operational independence.

Based in [[Kharkiv]], the Kraken Regiment has participated in several high-profile operations, including urban warfare, reconnaissance, and sabotage missions against Russian forces. It is known for its aggressive tactics and unconventional warfare, often conducting deep-strike raids behind enemy lines.

Due to its ties to Azov, Russian propaganda frequently portrays the Kraken Regiment as an extremist group, though the unit itself does not officially use far-right symbols or rhetoric. It remains one of Ukraine’s most elite and secretive special forces units, playing a crucial role in defending and liberating occupied territories.

h4. Insignia

* !asset #25342736: Current Insignia

h4. See also

* [[Kraken_(japanon)|]]
* [[Russo-Ukrainian war]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Kraken Regiment":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kraken_Regiment]

title: 3rd_assault_brigade
body:
The [b]3rd Separate Assault Brigade[/b] is a dynamic unit within [[Ukrainian_ground_forces|Ukraine's Ground Forces]], comprising approximately 900 soldiers. Originally established as a volunteer force in the early stages of the [[Russo-Ukrainian War|]], it was founded on February 24, 2022, under the leadership of "Andriy Biletsky":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andriy_Biletsky], a figure known for his role in creating the [[azov_battalion|Azov Regiment]]. Initially rooted in the Azov Special Operations Forces (SSO) and [[Territorial_Defence_Forces_(Ukraine)|Territorial Defense]] volunteers, the brigade was officially integrated into the Ukrainian military structure in January 2023. It has since played a pivotal role in intense combat operations, including the defense of Bakhmut and the liberation of areas like Kherson and Andriivka.


Much like its predecessor, the Azov Regiment, the 3rd Assault Brigade has faced scrutiny for its historical ties to far-right ideologies and the use of symbols such as the [[Wolfsangel]] in its early days, sparking controversy over alleged neo-Nazi associations. Critics point to its origins within the broader Azov movement, while supporters argue it has evolved into a professional fighting force, distancing itself from extremist roots as it merged with the Ground Forces. Russian propaganda continues to amplify these criticisms, portraying the brigade as a symbol of extremism to justify its actions in the conflict. Today, the brigade's insignia features a stylized "Idea of the Nation" symbol—three golden slashes—reflecting a shift toward Ukrainian national identity over past controversial emblems.

h4. Insignia

* !asset #25342728: Current Insignia

h4. See also

* [[Hanna Kovalchuk]]
* [[Russo-Ukrainian war]]
* [[Azov Battalion]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: 3rd Assault Brigade":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/3rd_Assault_Brigade]
* "YouTube: History and Symbols of the Azov Regiment":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HGdUtUefjCA]

title: azov_battalion
body:
The [b]Azov Regiment[/b] is a 900 men unit of Ukraine's national gendarmerie ([[National Guard of Ukraine]]). First based in Mariupol and initially formed as a volunteer militia during the [[Russo-Ukrainian war]], it has participated in eight engagements. The unit was founded in May 2014 as a volunteer paramilitary militia under the command of "Andriy Biletsky":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andriy_Biletsky] to fight pro-Russian forces in the Donbas War, and was formally incorporated into the National Guard on 11 November 2014.

The group has drawn controversy over its early and allegedly continuing association with far-right groups and neo-[[Nazi]] ideology, its early use of controversial symbols linked to Nazism (the [[black sun (symbol)|]], the [[Wolfsangel]] and the [[swastika]]), and allegations that members of the group have participated in torture and war crimes.  However, some experts argue that the regiment has evolved beyond its origins as street militia, tempering its neo-Nazi underpinnings as it became part of the Ukranian National Guard. 

Since 2014, criticism of the Azov Regiment has been a recurring theme of Russian politics and more recently as [[Vladimir Putin]]'s justification for invading Ukraine, the prominence of the unit in Ukraine's military forces being expanded and exaggerated by Russian media to this day.

The most recent official Azov Regiment logo now only uses a heavily altered Wolfsangel symbol, while the SSO (special forces) units don't use it at all (they use a [[tryzub]] formed out of swords instead).

h4. Insignia

* !asset #25342731: Insignia 2014-2015
* !asset #25342734: Current Insignia
* !asset #25342733: Variant without [[Wolfsangel]]

h4. See also

* [[Marichka]]

* [[3rd Assault Brigade]]

h4. External links

title: freedom_of_russia_legion
body:
The [b]Freedom of Russia Legion[/b] is a military unit composed of Russian defectors, volunteers, and anti-Kremlin fighters operating under the [[ukrainian_ground_forces|Armed Forces of Ukraine]]. It was formed in March 2022, following [[russo-ukrainian_war|Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine]], and consists of Russian citizens who oppose [[Vladimir Putin]]’s government and seek to overthrow it.

The legion has participated in combat operations against Russian forces, primarily in Eastern Ukraine. In addition to fighting on the frontlines, it has been involved in cross-border raids into Russia, particularly in the Belgorod region, aiming to destabilize the Russian regime and encourage domestic resistance.

The group is a frequent target of Russian state propaganda, which labels its members as traitors and terrorists. However, the legion claims to fight for a democratic and free Russia, positioning itself as an armed resistance movement against Putin’s rule.

title: marichka
body:
Marichka (more commonly known as Azov-chan) is a female character designed as the anthropomorphic representation of the [[Azov Battalion]], first appearing in late 2021 amidst rising tensions, and went viral following the start of the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]]. Her real name is "Maria".

Following the war, several characters were created in her wake, representing various Azov-friendly factions within Ukraine and its army, broadly lumped together into the 'Mariverse'. These characters include [[Kraken (japanon)|]], [[Eva (kavunyak)|]], [[Nika (usergore)|]], [[Olesya (miaz)|]], [[Paulinka (japanon)|]], [[Lera (sighttobehold)|]], [[Stepan (number-seventeen)|]], [[Levchenko Ahapiia Oleksandrivna]], [[Kupalinka]], [[Cossack (polish anon)|]], [[Emilia Plyaterska]], [[Hanna Kovalchuk]], [[Shefika (usergore)|]], and [[Kenneth del Duca]]. 

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Azov-Chan / Marichka":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/azov-chan-marichka

* "Marichka Wiki (Ukrainian)":https://marichka.fandom.com/uk/wiki/Вікі_Марічка

title: emilia_plyaterska
body:
Emilia Plyaterska (commonly known as "Emilia") is a female Belarusian character belonging to the [[Kastus Kalinouski Regiment]] within the [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Armed Forces of Ukraine]]. She has the position of [[mortar (weapon)|]]woman. She is one of the three Belarusian characters in the [[Marichka|Mariverse]], the other two being [[Kupalinka]] and [[Paulinka (japanon)|]].

She was created in 2023 by a Belarusian volunteer and political exponent of the Belarusian Irredentist Movement and designed by [[Linyvets Chan]] to represent the Belarusian volunteers fighting for Ukraine in the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]]. Emilia is presented as some sort of big sisterly, protective figure. She is presented with as a [[tall female|tall woman]] with [[blonde hair]] tied back in a [[hair bun|bun]], [[blue eyes]], [[freckles]] all over her body and [[large ears]] visible through her hair.

h4. External links

* "Marichka Wiki (English)":https://marichka.fandom.com/wiki/Emilia
* "Marichka Wiki (Ukrainian)":https://marichka.fandom.com/uk/wiki/Емілія
* "Author's Telegram":https://t.me/zhive_bielarus

title: kupalinka
body:
Kupalinka (full name unknown) is a female Belarusian character, member of the [[Kastus Kalinouski Regiment]] within the [[Ukrainian Ground Forces|Armed Forces of Ukraine]]. She is one of three Belarusian characters of the [[Marichka|Mariverse]], the other two being [[Emilia Plyaterska]] and [[Paulinka (japanon)|]].

She was designed by an actual Belarusian volunteer in 2022 at the outbreak of the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]], originally as a mere recolouring of Marichka. Paulinka is depicted as having [[brown hair|brown]] [[medium hair]], [[red eyes]], and a [[cz 805 bren|CZ-806 BREN-2]] rifle.

title: evil_neuro-sama
body:
Evil Neuro was the [[dark persona]] of [[Neuro-sama]] but is currently the "evil [[twins|twin]] [[sister]]". Her first appearance was on March 25, 2023.

She has [[red eyes]]; [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[hair between eyes|hair between her eyes]] and [[two side up|two side ups]] held by [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|hair ribbons]] with a [[skull hair ornament]], and a [[broken heart hair ornament|broken heart-shaped]] [[hairclip]]. She wears a [[school uniform]]: a [[black cardigan|black]] [[v-neck]] [[off-shoulder cardigan]] with [[long sleeves]] reaching [[sleeves past wrists|past her wrists]], with a [[red bowtie]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] and a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]]; [[uneven legwear]] with a [[black socks|black]] [[single sock|sock]], [[black socks|black]] [[single kneehigh|kneehigh]] and a [[bandaid on knee|bandaid on her knee]]; and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Her accessories include a [[red bag|red]] [[duffel bag|gymbag]] or [[shoulder bag]], and many [[button badge|button badges]] in the shapes of a pizza, a heart, a drone and a turtle soup badge.

title: nesoberi
body:
A line of [[stuffed toy]]s, initially made for [[Love Live!]], but that has since expanded to other franchises too. "Nesoberi" (寝そべり) literally means '[[lying|to lie down]]' or 'to sprawl'.

They are primarily manufactured by SEGA and distributed through resellers or as game prizes. They come in multiple sizes, from miniature sizes that can barely fit in the palm of your hand, all the way to Mega Jumbo size that are over a foot long and a headsize high. There have also been a few examples of Tera Jumbo Nesoberi for the Love Live cast, which can cover half of a whole bedlength.

A game based upon the Nesoberis was released for Japanese Exclusive mobile devices in 2018: [[Puchiguru Love Live!]], featuring only characters from μ's, Aqours, and Saint Snow. The game didn't last long and was shut down at the end of May in 2019.
The game was later revitalised on April Fools 2024, reskinned with assets from [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s 103rd Units.

h4. Franchises
What is shown here is only a handful of properties.

* [[BanG Dream!]]
* [[Fate (Series)]]
* [[Go-toubun no Hanayome]]
* [[Hololive]]
* [[Kaguya-Sama wa Kokurasetai ~Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen~]]
* [[Kemono Friends]]
* [[Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!]]
* [[Love Live!]]
* [[Lycoris Recoil]]
* [[Re:zero kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu]]
* [[Spy X Family]]
* [[Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari]]
* [[Touhou]]
* [[Vocaloid]]/[[Project Sekai]]
* [[Yuru Camp]]
* [[Zombie Land Saga]]

h4. Examples
* !asset #20212314: A nesoberi of [[Arashi Chisato]]

h4. See also
* [[Kuripan Plushie]] - a similar Love Live themed plush line starting in 2023, which resemble more conventional character plushes compared to Nesos.

h4. Other related plushes
* [[Fumo (doll)]]

* [[Mochimochi mascot]]

title: teddy_(pgr)
body:
Teddy, otherwise known as <spoiler>Christina Norman</spoiler> is a character from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], at first she was a NPC debuted during 'A New Divide' patch, and now a playable character. She is a Construct in service to Babylonia's Engineering Force, a colleague of [[Karenina (pgr)|]], the two often bicker with each other, but usually it ends in Teddy's favour. Voiced by [[Senbongi Sayaka]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair|pink]] [[straight hair]] and [[pink eyes]], wears a [[headgear]] resembling a pair of [[headphones]], both of her arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]] and she wears a [[metal collar]] on her neck.

Her apparels includes an innerwear [[bodysuit]] and a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[lab coat]] that is usually left [[open coat|open]].

body:
Basic frame for [[Teddy (PGR)|]].

h4. Appearance
In her Decryptor frame, Teddy has [[very long hair|very long]] [[pink hair]] with [[purple eyes]], has a pair of [[mechanical ears|mechanical ears]] resembling [[bear ears]], as well as a pair of [[behind-the-head headphones]]. Both of her arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]], attached at the bicep, and are black in appearance ([[colored extremities]]).

Clothing includes an [[open coat|open]] [[white coat]], [[short dress|short]] [[white dress]], and a pair of [[black boots|black]] [[combat boots]].

title: head_out_of_frame
body:
When the main subject's head is fully or partially cropped out of frame, but their torso is still in the frame. The head may be only halfway out of frame. The nose and mouth may be visible, but not the eyes.

The main emphasis should be on a single character's torso. Do not use this tag for [[faceless]] or mostly [[out of frame]] background characters, or for [[close-up|close-ups]] or a character's [[ass]] or [[lower body]]. This tag is for when the main subject's head is cropped out of the frame, not most or all of their body.
